docs.text: Araxxor basic Araxxor Basic Guide (Courtesy of #Unknown user) Preset Ranged Note: Downgrade as you see fit. ⬥ Familiar ⬥ Adrenaline Potion ⬥ perked with planted feet ⬥ + ⬥ Scrimshaw of Cruelty Melee Downgrade as you see fit. ⬥ Familiar ⬥ Adrenaline Potion ⬥ Antipoison++ ⬥ Armour Spikes ⬥ Scrimshaw of Vampyrism General Knowledge Important Things to be Aware of ⬥ Araxxor and Araxxi's enrage ranges from 0-300%, each kill adding 20%, the higher the enrage the more damage they deal. ⬥ Bring a pheromone or use an instance so Araxxor spawns weak to the weapons you're holding. ⬥ Araxxor uses a special attack after every 5 normal attacks. ⬥ Use or before each special attack. ⬥ Araxxor does not die until phase 3. ⬥ There are three paths in total, one of which will be blocked: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Top path (minions) - Northeast ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Middle path (acid) - East ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bottom path (darkness) - Southeast Special Attacks Special Attacks Cleave ⬥ Araxxor pulls you in and cleaves dealing heavy damage. Example • Run away. ​ Cocoon ⬥ Araxxor wraps you in a cocoon dealing constant damage. Example • Spam left-click anywhere on your screen to free yourself. • / beforehand reduces the time it takes to get free. ​ Web Shield ⬥ Araxxor covers himself in a web, and any damage dealt during this time is reflected back to you. Example • Stop attacking Araxxor and wait for the special to end. ​ Egg Bomb ⬥ Araxxor spawns a group of eggs, and fires a slow moving projectile towards you that explodes in a 4x4 radius. Example • Stand top of the eggs and wait for it to explode. ​ Minion Spawn ⬥ Araxxor spawns 5 spiders, one of which is a special one: a pulsing spider which rapidly heals Araxxor, or a mirrorback spider which reflects damage dealt to Araxxor back to you. Example • Stop attacking Araxxor until the special spider is killed. ​ Instakill Spider ⬥ Araxxor sends out a green blob marking the ground, from which a spider spawns and chases you. Example • Making contact with the spider results in instant death. • Run away using / and wait for it to explode on its own. ​ Light Spots ⬥ Darkness covers the room and one lit up spot appears. • Stand in the light to avoid taking damage • Utilize + ​ Acidic Spider ⬥ Looks like the Instakill spider but does not have a bar that fills over its head. • Harmless and best left alone. • Exclusive to phase 3 when middle path is open. ​ Acid Absorb ⬥ Araxxi absorbs leftover acid from phase 3, increasing her enrage. • Exclusive to phase 4 when middle path is open. ​ Acid Core ⬥ Excluse to phase 4, at 25k HP, Araxxi drains 50% of your adrenaline and spawns a blob that bounces around the room and deals heavy damage if it touches you. • If it hits you, move 1 tile then stand still. Phase 1 ⬥ Timegated phase - Burn the web of your choice and lower Araxxor's hp to <5000. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Utilize + / + + ⬥ Phase 1 special attacks: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cleave ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cocoon ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Web Shield Phase 2 Top Path ⬥ Lower Araxxor to <5000 HP and progress down the path to phase 3 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Utilize , aim to fit + both twice. / , aim to fit + ⬥ Additional special attacks: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Egg Bomb - Always the first spec of this phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Minion Spawn Middle Path ⬥ Timegated phase - Lower Araxxor's hp to <5000. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Utilize + / + + ⬥ Lure Araxxor to the acid pool, and then onto the ledge after the acid level hits ~57% to dissolve it. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In order to have space to dodge the Cleave special attack, go all the way up the ledge, then move 1 tile west (down) before Araxxor reaches you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Utilize / to reach the end of the ledge quicker. ⬥ Additional special attacks: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Egg Bomb ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Instakill Spider Bottom Path ⬥ Timegated phase - Survive and stay in the light spots. Araxxor will charge at you and prompt you to choose a direction to dodge. ⬥ Move to phase 3 when the wall breaks. ⬥ Additional Special Attacks: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Egg Bomb ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Light Spots Phase 3 ⬥ This is the phase where you finally kill Araxxor. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Utilize + / + ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Aim to fit both + twice / + + ⬥ Special attacks can occur from whichever 2 paths are open. Phase 4 ⬥ Kill Araxxi. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Utilize + + / + + ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If / is on cooldown, just use thresholds until you can use it. ⬥ Araxxi is able to use magic and ranged attacks if you stand beyond melee distance, and attacks with the style you are NOT praying against, making prayer flicking crucial. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Resort to if deemed necessary. ⬥ Special Attacks ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cleave ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cocoon ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Light Spots ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Minion Spawn ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Acid Absorb ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Acid Core Additional Hp-based Mechanics ⬥ 50k HP: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Araxxi stops using special attacks, gains increased damage, attack speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Soft cap: any hits above 5k are heavily reduced. ⬥ At 25k HP: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Araxxi spawns the acid core ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Utilize channeled threshold / before adrenaline drain (when Araxxi has ~27k hp). docs.text: Kerapac hm basic Hard Mode Kerapac Basic Guide (Courtesy of #Unknown user) Presets Note: If you have not overcharged your so it works passively, bring it instead of . Magic (Recommended) ⬥ Tank Armour for ⬥ Familiar ⬥ Spiritual Prayer ⬥ Essence of Finality - Zamorak Staff ⬥ perked with ⬥ Vulnerability Bomb ⬥ Powerburst of Vitality ⬥ : ⬥ : ⬥ : Runes for Range ⬥ Familiar ⬥ Spiritual Prayer ⬥ Essence of Finality - Dark Bow ⬥ perked with ⬥ perked with (if you have access to ) ⬥ Hydrix Bakriminel Bolts (e) ⬥ Ruby Bakriminel Bolts (e) ⬥ Vulnerability Bomb ⬥ Powerburst of Vitality ⬥ : ⬥ : Runes for (BP ) General Knowledge Phases ⬥ Kerapac has 4 phases, he transitions into next phase when brought down to 50k HP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kerapac has 450k HP per phase (phase 4 excluded), making it so you need to deal 400k damage each phase. Mechanics Summary Auto Attacks ⬥ Kerapac uses magic attacks throughout the entirety of the fight. Special Attacks ⬥ Shatter ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kerapac raises his staff in the air before slamming it down, stunning the player and spawning a time rift. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Move under Kerapac before he slams the ground to deny both the stun and the time rift. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Utilize channeled thresholds / while under Kerapac. ⬥ Jumping Slam ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kerapac flies into the air before diving on top of the player, stunning them and dealing constant melee damage, repeats 3 times. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Overcharged passive effect protects against the stun. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Pray and move out of range after Kerapac lands to stop the melee hits. ⬥ Lightning Strike ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kerapac spawns a lightning wall that travels across the room in a random direction, dealing hard typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Use / / to pass through the lightning walls. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Past lightning walls will be present in the phases that follow, meaning there is one lightning wall in phase 1, two walls on phase 2, and three walls on phase 3. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lightning walls keep going even if a new phase starts. ⬥ Time Warp ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Accessible after phase 2 starts. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 10.2s after activation, your position, adrenaline, cooldowns and HP are all reverted back to the point before activation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Special attack weapon cooldowns such as / are not affected. ⬥ Fury ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Exclusive to phase 4, the more stacks Kerapac and his echoes have the stronger their damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kerapac and his echoes start at 0 fury stacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 50 fury stacks are added upon each death of an echo. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 25 upon each death of a clone. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 25 upon the death of all echoes. Kerapac Attack Pattern Phases 1-3 ⬥ 3 Autos → Shatter → 3 Autos → Jumping Slam → 3 Autos → Lightning Strike → 7 Autos → Repeat from Shatter Phase 4 ⬥ Kerapac will only use auto-attacks. ⬥ Kerapac heals up to 200k HP and becomes untargetable. ⬥ Kerapac spawns 3 echoes of himself (100k HP each) and 3 clones of the player. Basic Rotations Note: resort to / where possible. Phase 1 ⬥ Magic: + → + → → + ⬥ Range: + → + → → + Phases 2 and 3 ⬥ Magic: → → → + ⬥ Range: → → → + Phase 4 Note: You will be under extremely heavy damage so spamming food is expected and required. Magic ⬥ Enter a side clone and place yourself between two Kerapac echoes. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• → → hop to the farthest clone → → hop back to the original clone. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Echo 1: Basics → → before ends. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Echo 2: ⬥ Go between Kerapac and the remaining echo, + while eating close to full. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Echo 3: → → basics → → + ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kerapac: + remaining thresholds + ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Utilize how you see fit. Range ⬥ Enter a side clone and place yourself between two Kerapac echoes. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• → → hop to the farthest clone → → hop back to the original clone. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Echo 1: Basics → → + before ends. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Echo 2: + basics. ⬥ Go between Kerapac and the remaining echo, + while eating close to full. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Echo 3: → → basics → → + ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kerapac: + remaining thresholds + ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Utilize how you see fit. docs.text: Raksha basic Basic Guide: Raksha (Courtesy of #Unknown user) Preset ⬥ Familiar ⬥ Laniakea's Spear perked with ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can replace with ⬥ Laceration Boots ⬥ Spiritual Prayer ⬥ Essence of Finality - Dark Bow ⬥ perked with ⬥ perked with (if you have access to ) ⬥ + Hydrix and Ruby Bakriminel Bolts (e) ⬥ Vulnerability Bomb ⬥ Powerburst of Vitality ⬥ : ⬥ : Runes for (BP ) General Knowledge ⬥ Raksha fight consists of 4 phases, with 200k HP for each phase (400k if duo). ⬥ Prayer flicking is crucial and mandatory as Raksha is able to use all three combat styles. ⬥ Raksha uses a special attack after every 4 normal attacks during phases 1-3, and after every 2 normal attacks during phase 4. ⬥ on to ensure 1k minimum damage with ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- To see if you meet the minimum damage requirement, go to dummies at war's retreat, set them to minimum hit mode, and use with your Raksha gear. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you did not meet the requirement, resort to / Recommendation Due to the nature of Raksha being very prayer-flick reliant, it is advised to practice prayer flicking with nothing but a weapon until death, while doing damage and dealing with mechanics. Repeat this until you get the hang of prayer flicking under pressure. Raksha Attack Pattern Image Courtesy of #Brad ‎ ‎Mechanics Summary Phases 1-3 ⬥ Rockfall ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Happens between phases 1-3 transitions. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 7x7 rocks fall from the ceiling that deal heavy typeless damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Small rubbles indicate the spots rocks will fall on. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Move out of the way before rocks hit the floor. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Utilise ⬥ Tail Swipe and Charge ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tail Swipe → If the player is in melee distance → Raksha spins around in a 3x3 radius. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Charge → If the player is outside of melee distance → Raksha charges towards the player. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Getting hit by either of those attacks results in heavy typeless damage and a stun. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Remain in melee distance to avoid getting a Charge attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Run out of spin radius once Raksha starts the Tail Swipe animation. ⬥ Shadow Bomb ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Raksha stuns the player before launching a shadow bomb that explodes and leaves a poison cloud in a 3x3 radius. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Raksha launches 3 bombs in phase 3. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- or beforehand to protect against the stun. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Move out of the bomb's radius before it lands. ⬥ 5X Shockwave ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Raksha walks to the middle of the room and unleashes 5 strong magic attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phase Raksha before he can reach this special attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Restart the fight if you receive said special attack. ⬥ Mind Poison ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Raksha immobilizes the player and spawns 2-5 orbs that deal constant typeless damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Failure of expelling the orbs will result in heavy typeless damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Click the orbs to expel them. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Clicking the orbs does not interrupt combat or channeled abilities. ⬥ Shadow Anima Pools ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Harmless 1k HP pools that spawn in 4 different areas. ‎ phase 3. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Raksha spawns a 10k HP melee minion during Mind Poison. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Pray against minion when Raksha isn't attacking, and focus on phasing Raksha. docs.text: Shadow reef melee basic Basic Guide: Shadow Reef (Melee) Disclaimer: This guide is not made for beginners to the melee style. If experience with melee is limited, it is still possible to solo ED3, but please consider referring to #dpm-advice-melee first or YouTube beginner guides on soloing ED3 with melee. For the sake of summary, all boss attacks and mechanics are mentioned relative to melee rotation timings and details are omitted. For full mechanics of bosses, visit #the-shadow-reef-melee . Preset ⬥ Igneous Kal-Ket with Strength Cape perk stored in max cape/anachronia cape stand ⬥ Halberd type weapon (Laniakea's Spear/Scythe) ⬥ Portent of item protection ⬥ Armour perked with the following perks: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Biting 4 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Undead Slayer (Preferably with Crackling 4) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Impatient 4 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Enhanced Devoted 4 ⬥ Scrimshaw of Vampyrism ⬥ Defender for defensives usage ⬥ Powerburst of Vitality ⬥ Powerburst of Acceleration ⬥ Expensive spices ⬥ Salve amulet (e) ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) ⬥ Equip whenever using , or . ⬥ If using a Scrimshaw of Vampyrism , a Blood Reaver should be used. ⬥ Other things used but not mentioned in preset: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Barge Important ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Flurry Important ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Limitless Important ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Undead Slayer sigil Good for Taraket ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Fury ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Powder of Protection ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Corbicula Rex perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Demon Slayer sigil ⬥ Recommended upgrades to preset: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• T90 armour ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lunging switch (highly recommended) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Flanking switch ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Gloves of Passage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ring of Death Relics : ⬥ Berserker's Fury ⬥ Blessing of Het ⬥ Fury of the Small Crassian Leviathan The first boss you will encounter is the Crassian Leviathan. Poison is extremely important for this boss to reduce its healing. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits : The center of the arena is filled with poison. Never stand here (not a concern with melee) or you will get stunned. ​ ⬥ Dragon Breath : The Leviathan fires a prolonged breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage to those caught in it. ⬥ Head Sweep : The Leviathan do 2 head sweeps, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area. ⬥ After doing a Dragon Breath and 2 sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Flanking can be used on the Crassian Leviathan on this side. Strategy ⬥ Avoid using Laniakea's Spear here due to accuracy issues, unless using or . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• + → mid gcd + → Target cycle + to begin fight. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleed to reduce cooldown. ⬥ Fight start: To avoid Dragon Breath , click repeatedly on one of the 2 tiles shown below in red boxes to ensure your character stays out. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You do not need to click if using a halberd type weapon. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Stop clicking when using a channel, to avoid cancelling. The channel itself will keep you in place. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Click while cancelling channels with a non-channeled ability to prevent movement. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Call familiar if needed. ⬥ Move between the 2 safespots shown above to continue DPS-ing losslessly while avoiding sweeps. ⬥ After , use basics prioritising together with 3-hit , and . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Start building to 91% adrenaline when the 2nd set of Head Sweeps begin. ⬥ When you're >91% adrenaline and is about to come off cooldown, off and , followed by a rotation. ⬥ and to the other side to finish Leviathan off if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safespots are in the same relative positions on this side. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Watch out for Dragon Breath . ⬥ Example kill: 1:10 https://youtu.be/LY1vZ7IfVW4 Taraket the Necromancer The second boss is Taraket which attacks using primarily damaging but slow Magic autos. You will need good DPS to avoid getting overwhelmed at this boss. is thus almost mandatory as it provides 20% additional damage and accuracy to Taraket and his minions. Mechanics ⬥ Rift of Undeath : Taraket spawns a rift with 30k HP that occasionally spawns skeletons. After 30 seconds, it explodes dealing heavy typeless damage. This is prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness : Taraket shrouds himself in , becoming immobile and switches from using Mage to Ranged, starting to hit harder. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity : At 200K HP, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly to either black crystal at the sides of the arena, healing for 100k HP and spawning a minion: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletons. ​ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Bloat will spawn first by default. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket will not spawn anymore minions after spawning both. ⬥ Spirit Line : While in after spawning both minions, Taraket will speak dialogue and smash the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that moves towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Flanking is applicable if the player moves behind Taraket during this brief period. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you Taraket right as he uses this attack, Taraket will turn around and you will completely avoid both attacks. Strategy ⬥ Use as much as possible as there are no accuracy issues. ⬥ To start the fight, execute a rotation on Taraket. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use here if owned. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If spawning Carrier first, move Taraket west after , such as using while standing east of Taraket. ⬥ flicking is extremely effective for Taraket as his attacks are slow and telegraphed. ⬥ Around the time ends, Taraket will spawn a Rift of Undeath . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Taraket still has >30k HP from 200K, perform the following abilities to phase him and kill the portal in time: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- followed by mid gcd. Walk back until 2 tiles from the south wall (lure demonstrated in gif below). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Use 2 defensives after . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- back and bleed a Threshold on the portal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Use AoE abilities targeting the portal to kill it and help phase Taraket to below 200k HP. Clear the skeletons spawned halberd with resets. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Taraket is near 200k when portal spawns, simply phase Taraket and use and powerful thresholds to clear the portal. ⬥If Taraket is flying and there is nothing to kill, use defensives or basics on Taraket to generate adrenaline. ⬥ What you want him spawning first depends on your level of skill as a meleer: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [1] Beginner : Spawn Bloat → Kill Bloat while AoEing Taraket → Phase Taraket → Spawn Carrier → Kill Carrier and Skeletons → Proceed to final phase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [2] Experienced : Spawn Corpse Carrier → AoE Corpse Carrier with Taraket → Finish off Corpse Carrier and Skeletons while Taraket spawns Bloat → Proceed to final phase (Recommended for preset in this guide) ⬥ If doing [2] : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use right before Carrier spawns → Auto with 2H + → → (walked if up) on Carrier and then focus Taraket. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Meteor Strike on Taraket and Carrier followed by AoE abilties. Phase Taraket using Assault . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Not phasing Taraket in time will cause him to kill any skeletons alive to heal himself. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Overpower and basics if needed to finish off Carrier. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use halberd repeatedly with resets to finish off any remaining skeletons. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Target Taraket and build to get 100% adren in preparation for final phase. ⬥ For the final phase, after Taraket has spawned bloat if doing [2] and after killing Corpse if doing [1] : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• → + → + activate to begin last phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After with , use bleeds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refresh , and finish the kill with , basics and Hurricane . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If lacking damage, you might need to kill more Rifts of Undead Taraket spawns. ⬥ During the final phase, walk behind Taraket immediately when he speaks while in to avoid taking massive damage from Spirit Line . ⬥ Example kill [2] : 2:11 https://youtu.be/aNZBcYmSCek The Ambassador The final boss of Elite Dungeon 3 is The Ambassador (Ambi), a highly damaging boss that attacks with 100% accuracy. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. flicking is heavily recommended, else a secondary preset with more food is likely needed just for Ambi. Mechanics ⬥ Ambi's attack rotation from 1M-550K HP (Phase 1): ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Purple Corruption : Ambi fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 2 Corruptions are dropped when the bar depletes, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones ramp up from doing 200 to 2000 typeless damage periodically to anyone standing inside. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Black Hole : Ambi will spawn a black hole which explodes a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stunning the blackhole negates the attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Sinister Fragments : At 650k or at 59 seconds, six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. Ambi will also fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Ambi absorbs any alive fragments after a minute, releasing a hard hitting typeless explosion per fragment absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ⬥ 550K-400K (Phase 2): Ambi mostly follows the same auto attack pattern from P1, but stops spawning Sinister Fragments . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ambi will periodically spawn 2 invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers. ⬥ 400K-0 (Phase 3): ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ambi will stop doing Purple Corruption and Black Hole , continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and Purple Corruption . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambi. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These will heal Ambi 2500 HP each upon contact. They can be blocked, directing a small amount of damage towards the player. ⬥ Magic Onslaught : Upon spawning the black hands, every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎This is signalled by Ambi saying "Fall now and be forgotten" , followed by opening his arms. Strategy ⬥ + → mid gcd + → Target cycle + to begin fight. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When you into the arena, Ambi's initial magic attack can be either Vengeanced or blocked with Disruption Shield (recommended for non- flickers). ⬥ Post , use whenever off cooldown, and as soon as you hit >60% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cycle through your thresholds afterwards except for . ⬥ Through out the fight, drop Purple Corruption smokes in quardrants. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• away to drop them from the 3rd smoke onwards to always have a quardrant to stand in. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Stand still after dropping the first smoke for another ability to drop both in the same spot. ⬥ Ambi will spawn a Black Hole . Powerburst of Vitality when the black hole's blue bar is around 1/4 to tank it. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ensure you have more than 50% HP when you do this. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Beware of getting potblocked. Do not drink any potions before using . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Stun the Black Hole if low HP. ⬥ Use as soon as it's up. ⬥ Use defensive basics and walk southwest at 0:59 to prepare for spinners. ⬥ It is recommended to clear 5 spinners, starting southwest. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Block the explosion from the leftover spinner using . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clear spinners using mostly basics and occasionally thresholds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If effective with damage and stalling abilities, get in a build while also clearing 5 spinners. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can TC + the southwest spinner (first spinner) when Ambi raises his arms, even before it appears. ⬥ After 5 spinners, target Ambi and get 100% adren. Use defensives to get 100% adrenaline and execute a rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Get in a 3-hit . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Remember to activate after this point whenever HP dips below 50%. ⬥ When black hands spawn, move with the smokes to block Ambi's healing. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use post and build to >80% spending excess on thresholds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Get in a 3-hit if intending to finish Ambi off with a before second Magic Onslaught . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use with to counter the first Magic Onslaught . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Return to flicking between and once the magic hits are over. ⬥ What happens next depends on your skill as a meleer and Ambi's hp: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Confident with melee, Ambi has less than 135k HP : Off Ambi and use a defensive followed by a rotation to finish the kill. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Otherwise : Use thresholds while keeping adrenaline >75% and use when ambi uses Magic Onslaught . docs.text: The first boss you will encounter is the Crassian Leviathan. Poison is extremely important for this boss to reduce its healing. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits : The center of the arena is filled with poison. Never stand here (not a concern with melee) or you will get stunned. ​ ⬥ Dragon Breath : The Leviathan fires a prolonged breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage to those caught in it. ⬥ Head Sweep : The Leviathan do 2 head sweeps, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area. ⬥ After doing a Dragon Breath and 2 sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Flanking can be used on the Crassian Leviathan on this side. Strategy ⬥ Avoid using Laniakea's Spear here due to accuracy issues, unless using or . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• + → mid gcd + → Target cycle + to begin fight. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleed to reduce cooldown. ⬥ Fight start: To avoid Dragon Breath , click repeatedly on one of the 2 tiles shown below in red boxes to ensure your character stays out. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You do not need to click if using a halberd type weapon. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Stop clicking when using a channel, to avoid cancelling. The channel itself will keep you in place. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Click while cancelling channels with a non-channeled ability to prevent movement. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Call familiar if needed. ⬥ Move between the 2 safespots shown above to continue DPS-ing losslessly while avoiding sweeps. ⬥ After , use basics prioritising together with 3-hit , and . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Start building to 91% adrenaline when the 2nd set of Head Sweeps begin. ⬥ When you're >91% adrenaline and is about to come off cooldown, off and , followed by a rotation. ⬥ and to the other side to finish Leviathan off if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safespots are in the same relative positions on this side. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Watch out for Dragon Breath . ⬥ Example kill: 1:10 https://youtu.be/LY1vZ7IfVW4

docs.text: The second boss is Taraket which attacks using primarily damaging but slow Magic autos. You will need good DPS to avoid getting overwhelmed at this boss. is thus almost mandatory as it provides 20% additional damage and accuracy to Taraket and his minions. Mechanics ⬥ Rift of Undeath : Taraket spawns a rift with 30k HP that occasionally spawns skeletons. After 30 seconds, it explodes dealing heavy typeless damage. This is prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness : Taraket shrouds himself in , becoming immobile and switches from using Mage to Ranged, starting to hit harder. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity : At 200K HP, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly to either black crystal at the sides of the arena, healing for 100k HP and spawning a minion: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletons. ​ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Bloat will spawn first by default. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket will not spawn anymore minions after spawning both. ⬥ Spirit Line : While in after spawning both minions, Taraket will speak dialogue and smash the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that moves towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Flanking is applicable if the player moves behind Taraket during this brief period. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you Taraket right as he uses this attack, Taraket will turn around and you will completely avoid both attacks. Strategy ⬥ Use as much as possible as there are no accuracy issues. ⬥ To start the fight, execute a rotation on Taraket. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use here if owned. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If spawning Carrier first, move Taraket west after , such as using while standing east of Taraket. ⬥ flicking is extremely effective for Taraket as his attacks are slow and telegraphed. ⬥ Around the time ends, Taraket will spawn a Rift of Undeath . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Taraket still has >30k HP from 200K, perform the following abilities to phase him and kill the portal in time: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- followed by mid gcd. Walk back until 2 tiles from the south wall (lure demonstrated in gif below). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Use 2 defensives after . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- back and bleed a Threshold on the portal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Use AoE abilities targeting the portal to kill it and help phase Taraket to below 200k HP. Clear the skeletons spawned halberd with resets. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Taraket is near 200k when portal spawns, simply phase Taraket and use and powerful thresholds to clear the portal. ⬥If Taraket is flying and there is nothing to kill, use defensives or basics on Taraket to generate adrenaline. ⬥ What you want him spawning first depends on your level of skill as a meleer: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [1] Beginner : Spawn Bloat → Kill Bloat while AoEing Taraket → Phase Taraket → Spawn Carrier → Kill Carrier and Skeletons → Proceed to final phase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [2] Experienced : Spawn Corpse Carrier → AoE Corpse Carrier with Taraket → Finish off Corpse Carrier and Skeletons while Taraket spawns Bloat → Proceed to final phase (Recommended for preset in this guide) ⬥ If doing [2] : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use right before Carrier spawns → Auto with 2H + → → (walked if up) on Carrier and then focus Taraket. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Meteor Strike on Taraket and Carrier followed by AoE abilties. Phase Taraket using Assault . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Not phasing Taraket in time will cause him to kill any skeletons alive to heal himself. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Overpower and basics if needed to finish off Carrier. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use halberd repeatedly with resets to finish off any remaining skeletons. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Target Taraket and build to get 100% adren in preparation for final phase. ⬥ For the final phase, after Taraket has spawned bloat if doing [2] and after killing Corpse if doing [1] : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• → + → + activate to begin last phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After with , use bleeds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refresh , and finish the kill with , basics and Hurricane . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If lacking damage, you might need to kill more Rifts of Undead Taraket spawns. ⬥ During the final phase, walk behind Taraket immediately when he speaks while in to avoid taking massive damage from Spirit Line . ⬥ Example kill [2] : 2:11 https://youtu.be/aNZBcYmSCek

docs.text: The final boss of Elite Dungeon 3 is The Ambassador (Ambi), a highly damaging boss that attacks with 100% accuracy. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. flicking is heavily recommended, else a secondary preset with more food is likely needed just for Ambi. Mechanics ⬥ Ambi's attack rotation from 1M-550K HP (Phase 1): ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Purple Corruption : Ambi fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 2 Corruptions are dropped when the bar depletes, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones ramp up from doing 200 to 2000 typeless damage periodically to anyone standing inside. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Black Hole : Ambi will spawn a black hole which explodes a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stunning the blackhole negates the attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Sinister Fragments : At 650k or at 59 seconds, six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. Ambi will also fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Ambi absorbs any alive fragments after a minute, releasing a hard hitting typeless explosion per fragment absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ⬥ 550K-400K (Phase 2): Ambi mostly follows the same auto attack pattern from P1, but stops spawning Sinister Fragments . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ambi will periodically spawn 2 invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers. ⬥ 400K-0 (Phase 3): ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ambi will stop doing Purple Corruption and Black Hole , continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and Purple Corruption . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambi. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These will heal Ambi 2500 HP each upon contact. They can be blocked, directing a small amount of damage towards the player. ⬥ Magic Onslaught : Upon spawning the black hands, every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎This is signalled by Ambi saying "Fall now and be forgotten" , followed by opening his arms. Strategy ⬥ + → mid gcd + → Target cycle + to begin fight. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When you into the arena, Ambi's initial magic attack can be either Vengeanced or blocked with Disruption Shield (recommended for non- flickers). ⬥ Post , use whenever off cooldown, and as soon as you hit >60% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cycle through your thresholds afterwards except for . ⬥ Through out the fight, drop Purple Corruption smokes in quardrants. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• away to drop them from the 3rd smoke onwards to always have a quardrant to stand in. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Stand still after dropping the first smoke for another ability to drop both in the same spot. ⬥ Ambi will spawn a Black Hole . Powerburst of Vitality when the black hole's blue bar is around 1/4 to tank it. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ensure you have more than 50% HP when you do this. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Beware of getting potblocked. Do not drink any potions before using . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Stun the Black Hole if low HP. ⬥ Use as soon as it's up. ⬥ Use defensive basics and walk southwest at 0:59 to prepare for spinners. ⬥ It is recommended to clear 5 spinners, starting southwest. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Block the explosion from the leftover spinner using . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clear spinners using mostly basics and occasionally thresholds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If effective with damage and stalling abilities, get in a build while also clearing 5 spinners. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can TC + the southwest spinner (first spinner) when Ambi raises his arms, even before it appears. ⬥ After 5 spinners, target Ambi and get 100% adren. When you see the last spinner enter Ambi, execute a rotation bleeding and channelling a 3-hit . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use right before the blue bar overhead ambi depletes. ⬥ Post , use whenever off cooldown, and as soon as you hit >60% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Build using basics and use as soon as it comes off cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Get in a 3-hit and maybe . ⬥ Tank the second Black Hole using if you can. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Be careful with this one as comes off cooldown close to when the black hole explodes. ⬥ Before dropping the 4th smoke , build to near 100% adrenaline and away to place purple smoke . Use defensives to get 100% adrenaline and execute a rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Get in a 3-hit . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Remember to activate after this point whenever HP dips below 50%. ⬥ When black hands spawn, move with the smokes to block Ambi's healing. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use post and build to >80% spending excess on thresholds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Get in a 3-hit if intending to finish Ambi off with a before second Magic Onslaught . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use with to counter the first Magic Onslaught . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Return to flicking between and once the magic hits are over. ⬥ What happens next depends on your skill as a meleer and Ambi's hp: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Confident with melee, Ambi has less than 135k HP : Off Ambi and use a defensive followed by a rotation to finish the kill. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Otherwise : Use thresholds while keeping adrenaline >75% and use when ambi uses Magic Onslaught . Use to finish the kill if needed.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use / to stand on a pad before the falling spore hits the ground ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players will be dealt 5-6k blight damage per pad missed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A Powerburst of Vitality can be used to survive missing (or skipping) pads ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- will also be required to survive skipping pads in larger groups Personal Blight Bomb ⬥ After pads, all players will have a bar above their head ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use or as the bar fills entirely to negate the 9-10k damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Proximity to Solak will affect when you are hit by an auto attack, which will change the timing of your / Volatile Rootlings ⬥ At 0:21, 8 Volatile Rootlings appear around the edges of the arena ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is recommended for each player to pre-place a set of two underneath rootling spawn points before starting the fight ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both should be placed same-tick ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- A second set of two can be placed while killing the remaining rootlings ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rootlings have 20,000 hp in a duo and gain 12,500 hp for every additional player in the fight ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If not killed by around 1:30, they will become Blightbound Lashers ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lashers will attack with and can deal heavy damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If two consecutive rootlings turn into Lashers, the second will heal to full Personal Roots ⬥ At 1:06, 2 random players will be given a text box informing that they have Blight Roots as well as a timer that counts down ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• There will be yellow arrows at the players' feet, on the minimap, and on the arena itself indicating where the roots will be coming from ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When the timer hits 0, the roots will launch towards the players' location in a triangle shape ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The player must move 1 or more tiles away from their pinpointed location and away from the roots to avoid damage and a stun ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- or before the timer reaches 0 to ensure you won't be stunned AoE Blight Bomb ⬥ At 1:32 and 1:49 (and throughout Phase 3, as well), up to 3 non-base roles will receive a bar above their head ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When filled entirely, an explosion will deal 3-4k damage (AoE) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• can be used for a heal ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively, , , or tank it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Solak's auto attacks will speed up after these bombs Arms and Legs ⬥ At 1:55 (1:06 for rootskips, 1:32 and 1:49 respectively for bomb skips), Solak will root his arms to the center of the arena ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Arms must be killed within 30 seconds ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After both arms die, Solak will stand up, exposing his legs. Legs must be killed within 20 seconds ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Being too slow on either arms or legs means that Solak will stand up and spawn Blightbound Lashers Core ⬥ After both the arms and legs have been killed, Solak will expose his core ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The core has 125,000 hp per person, and is exposed for 18 seconds ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If the core is not finished within this time, P1 mechanics will repeat ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Once the core is dead, Phase 1 ends and Phase 2 begins Phase Two Mechanics Eruptions ⬥ At the start of Phase 2, an eruption will spawn in each corner of the arena ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When killed, these eruptions will spawn a blue circle that will teleport everyone within up to the Anima Storm 5 seconds after the eruption dies Anima Storm ⬥ Persists from the beginning of Phase 2 until it is killed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Every 10 seconds, it will drop blight rain onto the arena hitting all players for 2k damage and will add a Blight Stack to the player's debuffs ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is destroyed by teleporting via the eruptions and spam clicking the storm in the sky ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As the storm "rains" down onto the arena, a puddle of blight rain will begin to form in the center ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stay away from the puddle as it hits for almost 2k damage per tick and will add a Blight Stack for each hit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- While in the sky, players can position themselves away from the center to ensure they return to the ground outside of the puddle Cleanse/Blight Stacks ⬥ In Phases 2 and 3, Merethiel can be clicked to activate a green circle on the ground at the south ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blight Stacks appear on the players' debuff bars ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It will remove all blight stacks from players standing within it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Players will do 1000 less damage per click to the Anima Storm per stack, and receive 1% more damage Blight Spores ⬥ 6 auto attacks after all eruptions die, Blight Spore bombs will spawn all around the arena ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Spores will rise into the air, fall back to the ground, and explode ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The longer the mechanic has progressed, the more damage they will deal ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Towards the end of the mechanic, they will hit up to 8k and should be avoided at all costs Anima Rain ⬥ 12 auto attacks after spores, five hits of Anima Rain will fall from the sky ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players should click the golden sphere in the north to consume the Blessing of Nature ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Immediately before the first rain, players should docs.text: Telos basic Basic Guide: Telos (Courtesy of #Unknown user) Presets With Statius's Warhammer ⬥ Ripper Demon Familiar ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ perked with ⬥ Weapon Poison +++ ⬥ Scrimshaw of the Elements ⬥ Statius's Warhammer ⬥ : ⬥ : ⬥ : (Runes for (BP ) Without Statius's Warhammer ⬥ Smoke Nihil Familiar ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ perked with ⬥ Weapon Poison +++ ⬥ Scrimshaw of the Elements ⬥ : ⬥ : ⬥ : (Runes for (BP ) Disclaimer This guide is made with the idea of getting started at Telos, and does not cover meta strategies, for that refer to #telos-0-999-magic . Enrage Mechanics ⬥ 50% : Virus is added on P2 and P3 ⬥ 100% : Phase 5 ⬥ 150% : Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 50 tick cooldown ⬥ 200% : Telos HP caps at 600,000 on P1-4 ⬥ 250% : Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 31 tick cooldown, and P5 will be stun-immunes after freedom for 10 ticks ⬥ 300% : Telos HP caps at 200,000 on P5 ⬥ 500% : P4 font HP caps at 10,000 ⬥ The higher the enrage the stronger the damage Telos and golems deal. Attack Pattern Important note: please refer to this image to see the order of special attacks for each phase, as the summary section below only explains new unencountered ones. ⬥ The numbers represent the amount of auto-attacks before said specials. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Keep in mind that the amount of auto-attacks carry from phase to phase, meaning if Telos used 2 auto-attacks in phase 1 before doing a special attack, he will only do 1 auto-attack in phase 2. Mechanics Summary Phase 1 Auto-Attacks Telos attacks with melee when the player is in melee distance, otherwise mage. Tendrils ⬥ Telos binds you in place, drains both your health and adrenaline, and heals himself for every hit the player takes. Example - Deal (3,000 + 10 x Enrage) damage to free yourself. Charge ⬥ Telos charges at the player after a short delay, dealing soft-typeless damage. Example - Use / / 1 tick after the text above Telos disappears. - Resort to / if necessary. Hold Still ⬥ Telos hits the player with a normal attack followed by a large melee hit that stuns, then jumps to the spot the player was standing on. Example • The normal attack can be either a melee or a magic hit, depending on how far the player is. - / beforehand to protect against the stun. - the large melee hit. - Move out of the jump radius. Green Beam ⬥ Spawns at a random location. • When the player is standing in the beam, they gain rapid adrenaline. • When Telos is standing in the beam, he attacks 1 tick faster. - Phase boss before beam comes out. Phase 2 Auto-Attacks Telos attacks with melee when the player is in melee distance, otherwise mage. Black Beam ⬥ Spawns on Telos. • When the player is standing in the beam, they deal and take 30% less damage. • When Telos is standing in the beam, the phase meter charges and he receives 20% less damage. - Pull Telos out of the beam and avoid standing in it unless necessary. Magic Onslaught ⬥ Telos stops moving and fires gradually stronger magic attacks until the phase meter is depleted. • Move Telos out of the beam before this attack starts so the bar doesn't fill too much. • If Telos starts this attack while in the beam, block it by standing in it. - Use , restort to and/or if the meter was charged too much. Virus ⬥ The player receives a coloured virus that deals constant damage. - Stand in the beam to clease the virus. Phase 3 Auto-Attacks Telos only attacks with magic throughout this phase. Red Beam ⬥ Spawns at a random location. • When the player is standing in the beam, they deal and take 30% increased damage. • When Telos is standing in the beam, the phase meter charges and he deals 30% increased damage. Phase Meter and Golems ⬥ Meter naturally decreases. ⬥ Meter increases when Telos is standing in the beam. ⬥ With 1 golem alive, the meter slowly decreases. ⬥ With 2 golems alive, the meter remains stationary (increases and decreases back and fourth). ⬥ With 3 golems alive, the meter increases. Shockwaves and Drain ⬥ If meter is on the left side → Drain: Telos drains the player's adrenaline and prayer points. Example ⬥ If meter is on the right side → Shockwaves: Rapid, hard hitting soft-typeless attacks. Example - Phase Telos before he could use Shockwaves, otherwise resort to Phase 4 Auto-Attacks Telos attacks with melee when the player is in melee distance, otherwise mage. ⬥ Phase 4 is split into 4 smaller sections, separated by 3 fonts. • Deal a quarter of Telos's starting phase HP to phase him into a font. • Once phased, you lose your target, Telos becomes untargetable, walks up to a font and spawns 3 different-coloured golems. Golems ⬥ Three different-coloured melee golems spawn at each font. Example • Red golems attacks are able to stun after their first 3 hits. - Utilise , resort to if you got stunned. • Red golems have normal attack range. • Green and black golems have halberd attack range. Fonts ⬥ To block Telos's instakill, players must walk up to and charge the fonts with their HP, for a total of 5 hits while dealing with golems. Example - Utilise + to reduce damage taken from fonts. - Relevant defensives do NOT work on the last hit of fonts. - Once the instakill is negated, all of your defensive abilities get placed on a 6s cooldown. Font 3 ⬥ Wrap around the center of the room and wait for the three golems to spawn. • When the golems reach you, target the furthest one → + + - See example here • Chrage the font and phase Telos into P5. Weak Anima Bomb ⬥ Telos fires a slow moving orb that deals soft-typeless damage. Example • The player's overload timer is constantly drained after getting hit until cleansed. - Ideally skip the mechanic, otherwise block using / - Cleanse the overload debuff by stepping into one of the fonts. So Much Power (SMP) ⬥ Once phase meter is filled, the next special attack is replaced by an SMP. Example ⬥ Telos fires a deadly soft-typeless attack paired with a normal attack (much like Hold Still). - Ideally skip the mechanic, otherwise block with or Phase 5 Auto-Attacks Telos only attacks with magic throughout this phase. Note: Telos attacks 1 tick faster if green beam is not blocked by the player. Strategy ⬥ Telos spawns 6 similar-colored minions at the start of the phase. ⬥ Make your way to the green beam. • Lure golems properly. - To do this, always start by going to the left beam. - If side beams → enter the 2nd tile in the green beam. - If back beam → enter the 4th tile in the beam. Rock ⬥ A single rock falls at certain times during the phase. - Utilise + Virus ⬥ The player receives a random-coloured virus that deals constant damage. • To cleanse the virus stand in the beam of the same colour. - Utilise + / Phase Meter ⬥ Gradually fills up • Once filled, Telos begins charging an instakill attack and receives heavily reduced damage. Example - Ideally kill before he can use this mechanic, otherwise Stunning Guide Mage has access to 3 different stun abilities: ⬥ Stuns for 1 GCD (3ticks/1.8s) ⬥ Stuns for 1 GCD + 2 ticks (5ticks/3s) ⬥ Stuns for the first 3 hits. docs.title: Attack Pattern

docs.text: Phase 1 Auto-Attacks Telos attacks with melee when the player is in melee distance, otherwise mage. Tendrils ⬥ Telos binds you in place, drains both your health and adrenaline, and heals himself for every hit the player takes. Example - Deal (3,000 + 10 x Enrage) damage to free yourself. Charge ⬥ Telos charges at the player after a short delay, dealing soft-typeless damage. Example - Use / / 1 tick after the text above Telos disappears. - Resort to / if necessary. Hold Still ⬥ Telos hits the player with a normal attack followed by a large melee hit that stuns, then jumps to the spot the player was standing on. Example • The normal attack can be either a melee or a magic hit, depending on how far the player is. - / beforehand to protect against the stun. - the large melee hit. - Move out of the jump radius. Green Beam ⬥ Spawns at a random location. • When the player is standing in the beam, they gain rapid adrenaline. • When Telos is standing in the beam, he attacks 1 tick faster. - Phase boss before beam comes out. Phase 2 Auto-Attacks Telos attacks with melee when the player is in melee distance, otherwise mage. Black Beam ⬥ Spawns on Telos. • When the player is standing in the beam, they deal and take 30% less damage. • When Telos is standing in the beam, the phase meter charges and he receives 20% less damage. - Pull Telos out of the beam and avoid standing in it unless necessary. Magic Onslaught ⬥ Telos stops moving and fires gradually stronger magic attacks until the phase meter is depleted. • Move Telos out of the beam before this attack starts so the bar doesn't fill too much. • If Telos starts this attack while in the beam, block it by standing in it. - Use , restort to and/or if the meter was charged too much. Virus ⬥ The player receives a coloured virus that deals constant damage. - Stand in the beam to clease the virus. Phase 3 Auto-Attacks Telos only attacks with magic throughout this phase. Red Beam ⬥ Spawns at a random location. • When the player is standing in the beam, they deal and take 30% increased damage. • When Telos is standing in the beam, the phase meter charges and he deals 30% increased damage. Phase Meter and Golems ⬥ Meter naturally decreases. ⬥ Meter increases when Telos is standing in the beam. ⬥ With 1 golem alive, the meter slowly decreases. ⬥ With 2 golems alive, the meter remains stationary (increases and decreases back and fourth). ⬥ With 3 golems alive, the meter increases. Shockwaves and Drain ⬥ If meter is on the left side → Drain: Telos drains the player's adrenaline and prayer points. Example ⬥ If meter is on the right side → Shockwaves: Rapid, hard hitting soft-typeless attacks. Example - Phase Telos before he could use Shockwaves, otherwise resort to Phase 4 Auto-Attacks Telos attacks with melee when the player is in melee distance, otherwise mage. ⬥ Phase 4 is split into 4 smaller sections, separated by 3 fonts. • Deal a quarter of Telos's starting phase HP to phase him into a font. • Once phased, you lose your target, Telos becomes untargetable, walks up to a font and spawns 3 different-coloured golems. Golems ⬥ Three different-coloured melee golems spawn at each font. Example • Red golems attacks are able to stun after their first 3 hits. - Utilise , resort to if you got stunned. • Red golems have normal attack range. • Green and black golems have halberd attack range. Fonts ⬥ To block Telos's instakill, players must walk up to and charge the fonts with their HP, for a total of 5 hits while dealing with golems. Example - Utilise + to reduce damage taken from fonts. - Relevant defensives do NOT work on the last hit of fonts. - Once the instakill is negated, all of your defensive abilities get placed on a 6s cooldown. Font 3 ⬥ Wrap around the center of the room and wait for the three golems to spawn. • When the golems reach you, target the furthest one → + + - See example here • Chrage the font and phase Telos into P5. Weak Anima Bomb ⬥ Telos fires a slow moving orb that deals soft-typeless damage. Example • The player's overload timer is constantly drained after getting hit until cleansed. - Ideally skip the mechanic, otherwise block using / - Cleanse the overload debuff by stepping into one of the fonts. So Much Power (SMP) ⬥ Once phase meter is filled, the next special attack is replaced by an SMP. Example ⬥ Telos fires a deadly soft-typeless attack paired with a normal attack (much like Hold Still). - Ideally skip the mechanic, otherwise block with or Phase 5 Auto-Attacks Telos only attacks with magic throughout this phase. Note: Telos attacks 1 tick faster if green beam is not blocked by the player. Strategy ⬥ Telos spawns 6 similar-colored minions at the start of the phase. ⬥ Make your way to the green beam. • Lure golems properly. - To do this, always start by going to the left beam. - If side beams → enter the 2nd tile in the green beam. - If back beam → enter the 4th tile in the beam. Rock ⬥ A single rock falls at certain times during the phase. - Utilise + Virus ⬥ The player receives a random-coloured virus that deals constant damage. • To cleanse the virus stand in the beam of the same colour. - Utilise + / Phase Meter ⬥ Gradually fills up • Once filled, Telos begins charging an instakill attack and receives heavily reduced damage. Example - Ideally kill before he can use this mechanic, otherwise

docs.text: Dpm advice general Introduction In RuneScape PvM, the meta at the time of writing is about pushing out as much damage in as little time as possible. It is important to understand that good and efficient PvM, especially at the higher tiers, is about squeezing out as much damage as possible in between mechanics. This channel will go over fundamental terminology, combat modes, and ways that you as a player can avoid making common mistakes while trying to improve your own damage output Terminology Common Abbreviations in PvM ⬥ DPM - damage per minute, a measure of how much damage is done over a minute time ⬥ DPS – damage per second, or in-general referring to damage ⬥ DW – dual wield weapon ⬥ 2H – two handed weapon ⬥ Juggling/Swapping – generally referring to switching between DW and 2H weapons to gain access to more damaging abilities ⬥ Camping – refers to using only one type of weapon, ie. 2H camping or DW camping ⬥ Rotation – refers to the usage of abilities and managing ability cooldowns ⬥ Switch – refers to a weapon or gear item that is equipped and use temporarily for its effects ⬥ Auto – an auto attack, NOT an ability ⬥ Tick – a unit of time in which a game action can occur. Runescape's tick is 0.6 seconds in duration ⬥ Lossless - meaning no ticks are lost in performing an action ⬥ GCD - global cooldown. An innate cooldown built into every ability. Lasts for 3 ticks (1.8 seconds) Note: For more abbreviations, see Evil Lucario's list of common PVM Lingo and Abbreviations: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yZmDhx-SJsrVo0iTNwgMN3YsuJ9CrHcySd3hptvz3Ds/ Revolution++ ⬥ Revolution++ is a combat mode wherein you can toggle the game to automatically activate basic, threshold, and ultimate abilities automatically upon reaching the required adrenaline ⬥ We do not encourage using Revo++ as it is severely limiting; however, it can be desirable for low-input play such as AFKing or Slayer ⬥ To toggle on revolution++ and highlight how many abilities to trigger with it, click the cog icon on your ability bar: Magic Revo++ Bars ⬥ Replace with if staff camping ⬥ With Igneous Kal-Mej unlocked: ⬥ Otherwise: Ranged Revo++ Bars ⬥ Replace with if 2H camping ⬥ With Greater Ricochet and Caroming 4 : ⬥ Otherwise: Melee Revo++ Bars ⬥ Dual-wield: ⬥ 2-Handed: Basic Revolution ⬥ Basic Revolution (commonly referred to as simply "Revolution") is a combat mode wherein basic abilities are used automatically by the game but threshold and ultimate abilities are manually activated ⬥ Newer players may find this combat mode helpful starting out as it allows for some control over your rotation but doesn't overburden you with managing basic abilities ⬥ Note that the thresholds and ultimate abilities can be placed in any order as it does not matter where they are on the bar − you will be manually activating them ⬥ With revolution activating all basic abilities, the following strategy is recommended: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Activate your damage boosting Ultimate / / once you reach 100% adrenaline ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- From there, use your thresholds and modified ultimates whenever you reach the requisite amount of adrenaline, and repeat ⬥ Following this simple repeating pattern of Build to 100% → Damage-Boosting Ultimate → Thresholds and Modified Ultimates → Repeat , one can expect to reach a moderate level of DPM with low-medium player input Magic Basic Revolution Bars ⬥ Replace with if 2H camping Ranged Basic Revolution Bars ⬥ Replace with if 2H camping ⬥ With Greater Ricochet and Caroming 4 : ⬥ Basic unlocks: Melee Basic Revolution Bars ⬥ Dual-wield: ⬥ 2-Handed: Full Manual Why to Use Full Manual ⬥ Full Manual is a combat mode wherein all abilities are manually activated by the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No automatic inputs from the game means no damaging abilities will be done, therefore this mode requires high input from the player ⬥ The benefit of this mode is that it allows for the greatest degree of control over which abilities are used in any given scenario ⬥ Most high level pvmers opt to use this combat mode How to Approach Using Full Manual ⬥ While it does not matter where you place your abilities on your bar with full manual, you may still find it helpful to organize your bar based on basics to thresholds to ultimates ⬥ Transitioning from revolution to full manual can seem intimidating, but all it takes is practice ⬥ Most players start by letting revolution activate basics while they manually input thresholds and ultimates ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The next step would be to manually activate basic abilities too, with revolution still active as a failsafe ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Once you feel confident in activating basic abilities manually, try turning off revolution ⬥ An exercise to help you here is to only use basics for a full minute of combat on a combat dummy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Your goal is to not lose any ticks between basic abilities, either due to cooldowns or due to not manually activating the next ability fast enough ⬥ Once you get comfortable at a combat dummy, try on a real boss such as GWD1 (Graador/K'ril/Kree) or GWD2 (Vindicta) ⬥ There is no easy "trick" to skip past the practice. It takes time to learn full manual so stick with it! ⬥ More information about the full manual transition available here: #revo-to-full-manual ‎ ‎Common Mistakes and How to Fix Them The following list notes some of the common mistakes made by players in PvM. It is likely that as you work towards improving your DPM, you will need to improve in one or many of these areas. The first step is recognizing what mistakes you're making, then working on the solution. Don't be discouraged if you don't get it right away, some of these mistakes are harder to fix than others. Remember, everything just takes practice Cancelling Channelled Abilities Late or Early Channeled Abilities ⬥ Concentrated Blast : 2hit (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Greater Concentrated Blast : 3hit (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Snipe : 1-hit (4t/2.4s) ⬥ Fury : 2-hit (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Asphyxiate : 2-hit (3t/1.8s), or 4-hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Smoke Tendrils : 2-hit (3t/1.8s), or 4-hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Rapid fire : 8-hit (8t/4.8s) ⬥ Assault : 4-hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Destroy : 4-hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Greater Flurry : 2-hit (3t/1.8s), or 3-hit (5t/3.0s) Note: The listed cancel timings are standard, depending on overall rotation the cancel time you use may vary Why it’s Important ⬥ It is important to properly cancel abilities in order to not lose any ticks, or damage potential ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Animations can be unreliable, and longer than the actual duration of the ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It can be higher damage-per-tick, or net you more adrenaline, to cancel long channels early ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Concentrated Blast , and Snipe may suffer a 1t delay when revolution is enabled How to Fix ⬥ The following videos demonstrate proper cancel timings for channelled abilities ⬥ Proper Cancelling of Magic Abilities https://youtu.be/DaCy60sZav4 ⬥ Proper Cancelling of Ranged Abilities https://youtu.be/939znioyCMA ⬥ Proper Cancelling of Melee Abilities https://youtu.be/y33z3WLM7H8 Ability Prioritisation Why it’s Important ⬥ As silly as it may sound, pressing stronger buttons will greatly increase your DPM moreso than any other gear upgrade ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In other words, you should know which abilities are strong in which scenarios, and use that to your advantage How to Fix ⬥ Take a look in #dpm-advice-mage , #dpm-advice-range , and #dpm-advice-melee to get an idea of how to prioritize each ability under certain conditions ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The numbers behind these can be found here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OetEUz4xU5sg7pqmJBkkafmZIye8qoPOXprUPGhin14/edit?usp=sharing ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note how the same ability can be prioritized differently depending on the scenario; for example: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Bleeds (including ) are lower priority when under the effects of damage-boosting ultimates / / , because their damage is not boosted by these abilities. In fact, if using a Berserker-variant aura , these abilities will actually be worse than if used outside these ultimates, as the direct damage boost from these auras is lost Managing Cooldowns Why it’s Important ⬥ Strong abilities often come with long cooldowns. This poses an inherent problem: if you use all your strong abilities at once, you'll be left with only weak abilities until they are available again How to Fix ⬥ Your goal should be to make use of "filler" abilities, ones with decent damage and short cooldowns, in-between your strong abilities in order to "manage" their cooldowns ⬥ Managing your cooldowns effectively will translate to a direct DPM increase, as you will be using fewer weak abilities overall ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Examples of such abilities are Sonic Wave , (Greater) Concentrated Blast / , (Greater) Dazing Shot / , Needle Strike , (Greater) Fury / , Cleave , and Decimate Losing Ticks Cause ⬥ Not inputting the next ability fast enough, having trouble determining what is the next ability, or clicking and being slow on weapon switches Why it’s Important ⬥ Same rationale as canceling channels. These losses add up over time to a large amount of wasted damage potential How to Fix ⬥ Practice lots. Try and think 2 abilities ahead and plan out your rotation Auto Attacks with Ultimates Why it’s Important ⬥ They are lossless, which means "free" damage with your ultimate! However, mistakes can result in them being outright lost, or its damage being significantly reduced, notably: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Not releasing the auto attack, or releasing a dual wield auto attack instead of a 2H auto attack How to Fix ⬥ Use a dual-wield ability before activating your ultimate, and immediately after activating your ultimate switch to a 2h and click on the target to obtain a free auto attack before the GCD is over ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clicking the target is only necessary if you clicked your Planted Feet/2h switch from your inventory. If you keybound everything, disregard clicking the target; the auto will come with no extra input needed Utilizing Flanking Why it’s Important ⬥ Your basic flanking ( , , ) are 260% abilities and are better than nearly any other basic ability in terms of damage How to Fix ⬥ Practice. Understand where it is feasible to use, how to do so, and make an effort to incorporate it into your rotation Changing Weapons Mid-Channel Ability Why it’s Important ⬥ Changing your weapon mid-chanel, for example, / , will cancel the ability ⬥ Therefore, precise timing is required to ensure you’re still getting all hits from your channel ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• There are further implications as well, for example, changing your main-hand during or after / will lose you the crit bonus from the ability How to Fix ⬥ Practice the timing as described earlier Table of Contents Introduction [Link]($linkmsg Terminology [Link]($linkmsg Revo++ and Action Bars [Link]($linkmsg Basic Revo and Action Bars [Link]($linkmsg Full Manual [Link]($linkmsg Common Mistakes [Link]($linkmsg Ability Cancelling [Link]($linkmsg Ability Prioritisation [Link]($linkmsg Managing Cooldowns [Link]($linkmsg Losing Ticks [Link]($linkmsg Auto Attacks with Ultimates [Link]($linkmsg Utilizing Flanking [Link]($linkmsg Switching Mid-Channel [Link]($linkmsg

The first step is recognizing what mistakes you're making, then working on the solution. Don't be discouraged if you don't get it right away, some of these mistakes are harder to fix than others. Remember, everything just takes practice
docs.title: ‎ ‎Common Mistakes and How to Fix Them

docs.text: Channeled Abilities ⬥ Concentrated Blast : 2hit (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Greater Concentrated Blast : 3hit (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Snipe : 1-hit (4t/2.4s) ⬥ Fury : 2-hit (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Asphyxiate : 2-hit (3t/1.8s), or 4-hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Smoke Tendrils : 2-hit (3t/1.8s), or 4-hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Rapid fire : 8-hit (8t/4.8s) ⬥ Assault : 4-hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Destroy : 4-hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Greater Flurry : 2-hit (3t/1.8s), or 3-hit (5t/3.0s) Note: The listed cancel timings are standard, depending on overall rotation the cancel time you use may vary Why it’s Important ⬥ It is important to properly cancel abilities in order to not lose any ticks, or damage potential ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Animations can be unreliable, and longer than the actual duration of the ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It can be higher damage-per-tick, or net you more adrenaline, to cancel long channels early ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Concentrated Blast , and Snipe may suffer a 1t delay when revolution is enabled How to Fix ⬥ The following videos demonstrate proper cancel timings for channelled abilities ⬥ Proper Cancelling of Magic Abilities https://youtu.be/DaCy60sZav4 ⬥ Proper Cancelling of Ranged Abilities https://youtu.be/939znioyCMA ⬥ Proper Cancelling of Melee Abilities https://youtu.be/y33z3WLM7H8

docs.text: Why it’s Important ⬥ As silly as it may sound, pressing stronger buttons will greatly increase your DPM moreso than any other gear upgrade ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In other words, you should know which abilities are strong in which scenarios, and use that to your advantage How to Fix ⬥ Take a look in #dpm-advice-mage , #dpm-advice-range , and #dpm-advice-melee to get an idea of how to prioritize each ability under certain conditions ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The numbers behind these can be found here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OetEUz4xU5sg7pqmJBkkafmZIye8qoPOXprUPGhin14/edit?usp=sharing ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note how the same ability can be prioritized differently depending on the scenario; for example: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Bleeds (including ) are lower priority when under the effects of damage-boosting ultimates / / , because their damage is not boosted by these abilities. In fact, if using a Berserker-variant aura , these abilities will actually be worse than if used outside these ultimates, as the direct damage boost from these auras is lost
docs.title: Ability Prioritisation

docs.text: Why it’s Important ⬥ Strong abilities often come with long cooldowns. This poses an inherent problem: if you use all your strong abilities at once, you'll be left with only weak abilities until they are available again How to Fix ⬥ Your goal should be to make use of "filler" abilities, ones with decent damage and short cooldowns, in-between your strong abilities in order to "manage" their cooldowns ⬥ Managing your cooldowns effectively will translate to a direct DPM increase, as you will be using fewer weak abilities overall ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Examples of such abilities are Sonic Wave , (Greater) Concentrated Blast / , (Greater) Dazing Shot / , Needle Strike , (Greater) Fury / , Cleave , and Decimate
docs.title: Managing Cooldowns

docs.text: Cause ⬥ Not inputting the next ability fast enough, having trouble determining what is the next ability, or clicking and being slow on weapon switches Why it’s Important ⬥ Same rationale as canceling channels. These losses add up over time to a large amount of wasted damage potential How to Fix ⬥ Practice lots. Try and think 2 abilities ahead and plan out your rotation
docs.title: Losing Ticks

docs.text: Why it’s Important ⬥ They are lossless, which means "free" damage with your ultimate! However, mistakes can result in them being outright lost, or its damage being significantly reduced, notably: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Not releasing the auto attack, or releasing a dual wield auto attack instead of a 2H auto attack How to Fix ⬥ Use a dual-wield ability before activating your ultimate, and immediately after activating your ultimate switch to a 2h and click on the target to obtain a free auto attack before the GCD is over ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clicking the target is only necessary if you clicked your Planted Feet/2h switch from your inventory. If you keybound everything, disregard clicking the target; the auto will come with no extra input needed
docs.title: Auto Attacks with Ultimates

docs.text: Why it’s Important ⬥ Your basic flanking ( , , ) are 260% abilities and are better than nearly any other basic ability in terms of damage How to Fix ⬥ Practice. Understand where it is feasible to use, how to do so, and make an effort to incorporate it into your rotation
docs.title: Utilizing Flanking

docs.text: Dpm advice mage Introduction ⬥ In RuneScape PvM, the meta at the time of writing is about pushing out as much damage in as little time as possible. It is important to understand that good and efficient PvM, especially at the higher tiers, is about squeezing out as much damage as possible in between mechanics. This channel will go over general damage output lessons, ability prioritizations, crafting a rotation, a learning path, common mistakes, and tips and tricks. General Background Knowledge ⬥ For general PvM terminology, DPM tips, and revolution bars, see #dpm-advice-faq Ability Prioritizations & Building a Rotation Ability Prioritization ⬥ Generally speaking, high damaging abilities should be prioritized and used more often than low damaging abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• However, there's a catch: high damaging abilities often come with long cooldowns ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you use all of the high damaging abilities at once, you will be forced to wait for cooldowns before you may use them again. During this time you are forced to use weak abilities ⬥ To avoid this problem, the trick is to use filler abilities (ones with decent damage and short cooldowns) in-between your high damaging abilities in order to pace your cooldowns ⬥ See this image for an idea of which abilities should be prioritized based on damage per tick (in a vacuum): Note: You should not necessarily use abilities in the listed order due to aforementioned reasons Building a Rotation ⬥ When building a rotation, ability prioritizations and cooldowns should be on your mind ⬥ You generally will want to prioritize building up to 100% adrenaline and activating Sunshine as soon as possible ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ideally, enter the encounter with 100% adrenaline so you may activate it immediately upon entry ⬥ Both within and outside of Sunshine , you will want to prioritize your strong thresholds, special attacks, and modified ultimates. These include Igneous Omnipower , Wild Magic , Asphyxiate , flanking Deep Impact , and Guthix Staff ⬥ Greater Concentrated Blast should form the foundation of your rotation. It is a very powerful basic ability with a short cooldown and provides a critical strike chance buff on a subsequent ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use often as a filler ability, in-between other strong basics (Wrack and Ruin , Dragon Breath , Corruption Blast , flanking Impact , and walked Combust ) and the aforementioned thresholds, modified ultimates, and special attacks ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A basic pattern of → Ability → Ability → repeat is recommended ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If not yet unlocked, or if camping 2H, can be substituted with Concentrated Blast (2-hit) or Sonic Wave , respectively ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The critical chance buff gained through / is wasted if the follow-up ability is a bleed ( / ) ⬥ Any basic ability with damage lower than Sonic Wave or Concentrated Blast is considered a weak ability (Wrack , Tuska's Wrath , Sacrifice , non-flank Impact , Chain , unwalked Combust ) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These should be largely avoided ⬥ Juggling both DW and 2H weapons gives you access to both (Greater) Concentrated Blast / , and Sonic Wave as filler abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This may provide you with more breathing room while improvising rotations ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Care should be taken while weapon juggling so as not to delay usage of if unlocked. In this case, should only be used as a fallback to take the place of a weaker ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If is not yet unlocked, a general pattern of → Ability → → Ability → repeat is recommended ⬥ Generally, if using Exsanguinate , it is recommended to use Wrack and Ruin if the alternative is weaker than Dragon Breath ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This means Blood Tithe stacks can be retained to boost strong basics such as or
