docs.text: The shadow reef magic The Shadow Reef (Courtesy of #Linie & #Akva) Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow This guide is structured in the order that rooms would be encountered if running the dungeon. Rotations are written to utilize the Greater Chain ability and assume 4TAA is used; however, neither is required to effectively do this dungeon. Each solo run of ED3 is worth 20,363,636 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 3.5 kph, earning on average 71,272,727 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. ⬥ Luck of the Dwarves will not improve unique drop rates. Presets Note: The dungeon can be effectively run with a single preset but for general speed reasons a separate preset should be used for Ambassador. Universal ⬥ Undead Slayer ability ⬥ Undead Slayer perk ⬥ Salve Amulet for undead mobs and Taraket ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ Spiritual Prayers - use with a Ripper Demon familiar. ⬥ Weapon Poison ⬥ Maniacal Aura Note: Mahjarrat Aura is also ok and makes the Taraket strategy noticeably easier to execute. Optional ⬥ A few empty inventory spaces if picking up charm drops. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elite Dungeon chest upgrade solves this issue. ⬥ Adjust food as seen fit. ⬥ Lucky Charms ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doesn't increase Eldritch drop rate. ⬥ Flanking 4 - not super impactful especially in solo. Beginner/Group ⬥ Bringing both dual-wield and 2h is optional and should be done if the player is comfortable with switching. ⬥ Guthix Staff for increased hitchance ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced Solo ⬥ Powerburst of Acceleration ⬥ Virtus Book - Caroming 4 ⬥ Undead Slayer perk - anywhere on gear ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Essence of Finality - Armadyl battlestaff ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced Solo Ambassador ⬥ Powerburst of Vitality ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Relevant Mob Breakdown Crassian Scout ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Ranged hits. Crassian Scuttler ⬥ Life Points : 9,000 ⬥ They attack with moderately damaging Melee hits. Crassian Warrior ⬥ Life Points : 22,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Cloaked Zealot ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Summon Crassian : Can spawn Crassian mobs to attack you with. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Armoured Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Ulthven Necromancer ⬥ Life Points : 16,500 ⬥ Summon Undead : Can spawn a continous horde of Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Huge Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Sea Horror ⬥ Life Points : 35,500 ⬥ Scream : A 2,000 typeless hit used at melee distance. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. Enlightened Sotapanna ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with melee abilities for moderate damage. Undead Witch ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with a delayed, highly damaging Magic hit. Kal'gerion Demon ⬥ Life Points : 33,700 ⬥ Life Drain : Reduces your Constitution level by 2 ⬥ Demonic Ritual : Reduces all combat stats alongside rapid magic damage to anyone in range. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits otherwise. Warped Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Frenzy : Rapid 3,000 magic hits that also heal the Skeleton. Triggers are unknown. ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. First Floor - Pre-Crassian Note: All Greater Chain are assumed to be done with the Caroming 4 perk. Room 1 Tag mob 3 with → → (tc mob 2) → (tc mob 1) → run past mob 4 and use . Room 2 Surge and run straight along the path before bladed diving behind the Scouts. ‎ ‎Tag the northern most Scout with gChain then charge Detonate → (tc) . and into the next room. Room 3 Tag with (dw) gChain → and clean up the survivors. Room 4 There's only two Cloaked Zealots to clear here and they're lined up for AoEs but if you're quick your Detonate will still be on cooldown from Room 2. ‎ ‎Do → → → / . Bladed dive → surge into the next room as shown below. Room 5 There are two Crassian Scouts and two Cloaked Zealots spaced apart here. gChain one of the Zealots and use Asphyxiate . Clean up any stragglers with basics. Bladed dive diagonally into the next room. Note: Here and anywhere else in the mob sections of this guide, when using → you should not auto in between as it is important that your main target does not die early. Room 6A Equip your salve amulet and tag a Zombie with gChain . Charge Detonate → (tc) . Bladed dive diagonally across the rock to Room 6B. Room 6B Use Corruption Blast first if gChain is still on cooldown. Otherwise use → → → Room 7 Spam surge to use it as soon as you can. Aim to gChain a more central Zombie to ensure it reaches the Zombie close to the barrier. Use either Wild Magic or Guthix Staff here depending on speed and clean up with autos and bleeds. Blade dive diagonally into the next room. Room 8 You only need to kill the two Zealots. Detonate → → should be adequate to clear this room and end on high adren for Leviathan. The Crassian Leviathan As the first boss of The Shadow Reef, The Crassian Leviathan has a very small and easy set of area denial mechanics that can deal a lot of damage if ignored. The boss heals passively over the duration of the fight, largely negated with Weapon Poison active. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits + Additional Heads - The center of the arena is filled with poison and is surrounded by the additional heads of the Leviathan. Never stand here. ⬥ Dragon Breath - This will always be the first mechanic of the fight and is signaled by the Leviathan firing a stationary breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage. Stand off to the side to avoid this. ⬥ Head Sweep - The Leviathan will slam its' head across the ground twice, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area, avoided by moving to the opposite side of where the sweep begins. ⬥ After going through one Dragon Breath and two sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other opposite side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge to the opposite end of the arena. Strategy ⬥ Aim to Sunshine right away either directly in front of the Leviathan's nose or on the same tile you throw vuln bombs to (directly east of the Leviathan's head). Both spots allow for you to safely hit the boss in while avoiding the Head Sweep special. Drink your apot and look to use → . ⬥ At this point the Head Sweep will have started. Use an Guthix Staff spec either before or after you move to dodge the Head Sweep followed by a Detonate after dodging once. Get in another → → before you ends. ⬥ After your ends, try to just use thresholds to do damage up until it switches sides. If your damage doesn't look too great when you hit about the 1 minute mark, try to build to high adren to use a Metaphoris + Limitless immediately after the switch. Otherwise look to finish the boss off with more thresholds and Guthix Staff specs after the switch. Note: Leviathan switching sides counts as walking for Combust so look to use that as one of your last abilities on the initial side. ⬥ Example Kill: https://youtu.be/wdwPoXs06q0 Post-Crassian - Second Floor Entry Room 9 Drink your Acceleration Powerburst exiting the Leviathan and utilize surge and bladed dive as demonstrated below to quickly reach this room. There is a Cloaked Zealot and various Scuttlers in this room you need to clear to proceed. gChain the Zealot and use Asphyxiate followed by Dragonbreath . If your does not hit all the Scuttlers, you may want to use Corruption Blast before . Diagonally bladed dive into the next room. Room 10 Put your salve amulet back on. In the middle of the room, tag a Zombie with gChain and charge Detonate → (tc) . Surge → bladed dive → to reach the cliff. Room 11 Jump down the cliff to clear an Ulthven Necromancer and two Huge Skeletons. Use gChain → Asphyxiate on the Necromancer to clear the entire room. Room 12 There are two Necromancers off at the sides and a line of three Armoured Zombies guarding the door. You only need to kill one Necromancer and the Zombies to proceed to section 2, the temple area. Run to the archway and surge straight before diagonally bladed diving towards a Necromancer. Kill the Necromancer with Wild Magic → Combust . Use gChain on an Armoured Zombie and charge Detonate → . Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry Room 1 There are two Ulthven Necromancers guarding the gates to the east and west that you must clear to access the black stone artefacts. The main gate will not drop until these have been activated. A mass of summoned skeletons will form in the room as you go about this task. Equip your and surge + bladed dive down the path. Go west first and kill the Necromancer with → → . through the open barrier to go tag the artefact. diagonally back to the doorway and through. Kill the east Necromancer with → and towards the doorway. Go tag the artefact then run back and diagonally towards the bridge. Demonstrated: https://youtu.be/dGDwdi6PojI Room 2 Surge twice down the bridge to the two Sea Horrors and a Necromancer that you must clear to proceed. Use gChain → Asphyxiate → Dragonbreath on the east Horror while running to the far northeast corner. Charge Detonate on the west Horror → . The Necromancer should die to AoE during this clear but kill with basics if it suvives. Diagonally bladed dive to the next hallway afterwards. Note: It is ok to use Devotion here, but it should ideally be before reaching the Horrors. Room 3 There's a line of three Acolytes of Seiryu guarding the gate here that must be cleared to proceed. Tag the northernmost Acolyte with gChain and use Wild Magic before switching targets. Finish off the survivors with Dragonbreath and Corruption Blast . Immediately after clearing this room, drink your Acceleration Powerburst to bladed dive back to back to back as demonstrated below. Room 4 There are many mobs here but only the Necromancers and Huge Skeletons must be cleared. Put your salve amulet back on and use gChain → Asphyxiate → Dragonbreath on the western Necromancer. Finish off what's left with basics, but try not to use Corruption Blast as it will stop your from banking at the chest. Taraket the Necromancer This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes. Mechanics ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged. These autos are slightly stronger than his Magic ones. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity - Upon reaching 200K hitpoints, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly towards one of the two black crystals at the sides of the arena, healing himself and spawning one of the two corpses: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletal mobs as it's alive ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's attacks. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both of these attack with melee and are very easy to kite if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket can only spawn these once each and will not heal upon hitting 200K HP afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first spawn will always be the closest crystal to Taraket. ⬥ Spirit Line - Taraket smashes the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that will move towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move out of the way as needed be. Strategy ⬥ Utilizing 4TAA with Blood Barrage and gChain will make a world of difference in this fight in particular allowing players to essentially tank almost everything, especially on Mahjarrat Aura rather than Maniacal . ‎ ‎With , the last 300k can be sketchy at times; however, it is very much worth using. ⬥ Start out the fight with an apot Sunshine and your salve amulet equipped. → → → → (→ if Taraket is still above 200k hp) / the Rift → to clear the skeletons → + the Bloated Monstrosity → run back to just west of where Taraket was before flying and charge on him → → → (→ → if not phased but try to stay high adren) Note: Where you stand is important here as you're looking to body block Taraket from flying west. ⬥ Equip → on the Bloated Monstrosity and build back to 100 to back on Taraket and build with 2 basics → → → → step to the other side of Taraket before the Corpse Carrier reaches melee distance to effective stack it on top of Taraket Blocking + + Stacking Demonstrated: Note: Stacking Corpse Carrier in this way is not 100% guranteed and it is very important that you move back through Taraket to restack if it does not work. → → → → → → ( ends) ⬥ From here finish off taraket with more thresholds and . Be sure to side step the melee hits from the Spirit Line special as they will severly hurt your ability to outheal the majority of the damage you take. Also use off cooldown (preferably before thresholds or ) to improve overall healing and to repeatedly clear out the skeletal mobs the Corpse Carrier spawns. A second rift will spawn but you should be killing Taraket before it explodes so you can generally ignore it. ⬥ The Dark Form prayer is helpful here especially if using Spiritual Prayers . Note: Untested but players who do not 4TAA can likely follow this strategy up until when the Corpse Carrier spawns, at which point they would want to focus it down while in Sunshine . ⬥ Example Kill: https://youtu.be/qhA1C_HZrPQ Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit Note: This section and the following section can be cleared fairly easily with little to no food. As such, do not bank after Taraket even if running low. Room 5 Surge + bladed dive → out of Taraket's room. There is a Sea Witch and two Armoured Zombies in this room. Tag the Witch with gChain → Asphxyiate /Wild Magic /Guthix Staff depending on cooldowns following Taraket. into the next room. Room 6 Put back on your Essence of Finality . Only the Kalgerion Demon needs to be killed here to proceed. He's really big and impossible to miss. If you have it, the Demon Slayer ability can be used here. Guthix staff (dw) → Asphyxiate /Wild Magic should be enough. The Demon Slayer ability can be used here if you already own it. After killing the demon, look to utilize surge and bladed dive and an Acceleration Powerburst as demonstrated below. Note: You can manipulate one of the required Necromancers in room 7 to move from his position to make the next room easier on you by running as close as you can to him, so he aggros you through the wall. This isn’t 100% guaranteed. Room 7 There's two Necromancers hiding around in this room that need to be cleared. Use either Wild Magic or Guthix Staff followed by Combust on the west Necromancer then surge back towards the east Necromancer. If low on Hp or food use gChain → Asphyxiate on the east Necromancer, otherwise simply . Diagonally bladed dive through the corner into the next room and keep running to angle yourself for the next surge . Room 8 Only the two Necromancers are guarding the gate here. Kill the first Necromancer with Sonic → Guthix Staff then surge diagonally through the corner to the second Necromancer. Kill it with Wild Magic → Corruption Blast and diagonally bladed dive through the corner to the cliff. Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador Room 1 Use surge twice to reach the group of Crassian Warriors and Scuttlers around the gate that must be killed. They stack up very nicely for all AoEs and aren't very threatening in general. Tag a Warrior with gChain → Combust on your way to the barrier and charge a Detonate → → (→ → if bad ). Improvise to finish off the survivors. Room 2 There's two Warped Skeletons in here that can completely clear you if you aren't paying attention. Equip your salve amulet and gChain the two Skeletons. Proceed to Asphyxiate → (tc skeleton 2) → . Surge into the next room and immediately bladed dive behind the line of Zealots. Room 3 Re-equip your Essence of Finality and use gChain on either one of the eastern Zealots or Skeleton if close. From here use Tsunami then improvise to finish off the stragglers ideally with Detonate . Room 4 The last room before the final boss of the dungeon. There are two more skeletons along with two Crassian Scouts that need to be cleared to proceed. There are three minibosses that can spawn in this room with a fairly inconvenient aggro range so try to avoid them by hugging the western wall. Ideally look to gChain the Skeletons → Asphyxiate → Combust /Corruption Blast . Build on the Scouts to ensure you have full adren for Ambassador. Note: If no minibosses spawn in this room, look to zoom to the door and all 4 mobs. Kranon, the Ambassador At the bottom of the abyssal section awaits Kranon, the Ambassador, the final boss of the Elite Dungeon 3. This boss has a moderate learning curve compared to most solo bosses and has a variety of mechanics ranging from DPS checks, area denial, self-healing, and the usage multiple combat styles. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. Ambassador's Attack Rotation ⬥ 1M HP to 550K - Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ⬥ 550K to 400K - Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Uses the same auto attack rotation until Ritual. ⬥ Ritual - Kill ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 autos → Melee/Magic → 5 autos → Melee/Magic → Onslaught 1M-550K HP ⬥ Purple Corruption ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them at the Ritual phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the Sanctum Guardian's mechanic from ED1 but will create two areas instead, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones will last until the final phase of the fight and will ramp up to 2000 typeless damage to anyone standing inside. ⬥ Black Hole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador will spawn a black hole near the area that will explode a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Despawned by stunning it. ⬥ Sinister Fragments ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. At the same time, the Ambassador will fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Failing to destroy a fragment(s) prompts the Ambassador to absorb them, and release a hard hitting typeless explotion per fragment absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He'll use the Fragments one minute into the fight or by hitting the 650K cap. Burn! Like the ants you are. A fragment is absorbed 550K-400K HP ⬥ The Ambassador stops spawning Sinister Fragments. ⬥ The Ambassador spawns invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers that deal low ranged damage, making Resonance harder to use. 400K-0 HP ⬥ The Ambassador will stop doing his corruption and black hole mechanics, continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ⬥ Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and infested areas. ⬥ A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These will heal the boss 2500 HP for each smoke let in and can be blocked, directing a small amount of damage towards the player. Seiryu arrives Ritual begins ⬥ Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks. Ambassador Strategy General Tips ⬥ Use a Ripper demon with scrolls and drink Spiritual Prayers . ⬥ Try to avoid using solid food. Stick to Blue jellies , and Guthix rest or Saradomin brews , if you can. ⬥ Try to maximize the potential healing from soulsplitting Spinners and the Seiryu Heal at 400k to cut down on food usage throughout the fight. Resonance can also be used on the magic auto attack occasionally to preserve food. ⬥ You will need to Spellbook Swap to use Disruption Shield throughout the fight. Bring runes accordingly. ⬥ Flanking can be utilized throughout the fight by stepping directly underneath the Ambassador. Phase 1 - 1M-650k HP Note: Most autos and basics will be omitted in the rotations below. If either is listed below, the timing achieved is intentional. Also all Detonate are charged for 3 ticks. ⬥ Magic 1st Auto vs Melee 1st Auto ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doing → (during gcd) to reach melee distance instantly at the start of the fight will switch the 1st auto into a melee auto. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Changing the 1st auto into a melee auto changes the timing of the 1st smoke. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Mage 1st auto leads to a 22.8s (38t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Melee 1st auto leads to a 31.8s (53t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No other timings are changed. Note: The rotation in this guide assumes Magic 1st auto for timings. ⬥ Start the Fight with an Apot Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Disruption Shield while running down the ramp + → → → run to the north/northwest corner of your while waiting to auto → → (1st smoke timer will start + switch to for the 2nd magic auto) → → move out of smoke → (3rd magic auto) → → clear black hole with immediately (timer will be close to ending) ( ends) build with basics → → (2nd smoke timer starts) → (4th magic auto will come out towards the end of smoke timer) → move out of smoke → → → ⬥ Phase 1 Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Try to place the 2nd smoke next to your 1st smoke. This will put them out of the way as after spinners you will primarily stay south/southwest of Ambassador while also leaving a large path on the east side for pathing during spinners. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you switch prayers properly and the last magic auto attack, it is fairly straight forward to no food phase 1 starting from full hp. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on where the black hole spawns, you may need to start moving early to reach it in time. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Be careful that you do not stall then cancel . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Having the flanking perk equipped will cause to not clear the black hole. Phase 2 - Spinners ⬥ Spinner Strategy (not all basics listed) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1st: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 2nd: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3rd: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 4th: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5th: → basics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 6th: ignore and build on Ambassador ⬥ Spinners Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You only need to kill 5 out of 6 and then use either or to block the explosion hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No movement abilities are required to effectively move between spinners; however, if desired, it is recommended to use Bladed Dive as its cooldown will be reset by each spinner death. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Using Vulnerability bombs on each of the spinners is not necessary but recommended. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The spinners are not immune to binds and therefore Ice Barrage + Wrack can be utilized. Phase 3 - 650k-400k ⬥ Natural Instinct Sunshine → 3-4 basics → the eruption → → (5th magic auto) → (3rd smoke timer start) → → move → (6th magic auto) → → clear black hole with immediately build with basics → (7th magic auto) (if bad adren skip to not delay next ) → (dw) ⬥ Phase 3 Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you are confident in your ability to on tick, you can the 7th magic auto here to save food. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Try to end this phase on very low hp for a large heal from Seiryu but beware as flicking to to block a magic auto will still cost you somewhere around 2-3k hp. Phase 4 - Ritual (400k-0 HP) ⬥ General Strategy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking the Healing Smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Understand your character as a wedge when blocking smoke. You can always block 2 smoke directions at once so whenever you have to move, rather than moving to block the current smoke, move to block the current smoke and the next smoke . For this reason it is also more beneficial to move to melee distance for this phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively you can spam click under him to block all of the healing smoke without needing to move, though this is also the most click-intensive and difficult thing you can do. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking Magic Onslaught (from most to least ideal) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Devotion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Vitality Powerburst ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Debilitate ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Vitality Powerburst + Shield Dome Note: is very dangerous and is only to save kills following misjudgements. You should never want to use this method. Timing a for hp or using to block the 1st hit of Magic Onslaught also helps this method but adds even more risk. ⬥ Apot Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Run underneath and activate Sunshine . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This will allow you to move to block smokes while remaining in . + → → → → → → → (sun ends) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Devotion to block the Magic Onslaught Note: Very unideal but depending on the timing you may need to activate Limitless to . ⬥ Last 100k or So ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on the hp remaining, you have 3 options here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The right option is a judgement call and takes practice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Factors to consider include: hp remaining, food remaining, availability, dps, and confidence ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Safe and Slow - use a thresh or 2 then build to Sunshine → → → build (save ) + eat → → + the 2nd Magic Onslaught (may come before or after asphyx) → improvise with thresh ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option is slow as it generally will not finish the kill until some time after the 2nd Magic Onslaught; however, this option is the safest as it always has access to a safe approach to dealing with the Onslaught. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All-in for the Skip - use a thresh then build to → → → 2 basics → → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option should be fairly consistent in skipping; however, it leaves you in a bad way if you fail the skip with the only option being to resort to . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Example: https://youtu.be/sjP9TMF_0nM ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Speed - assuming hp remaining is fairly low, spam thresh and Guthix Staff EoF to kill before 2nd Magic Onslaught → → → → → improvise ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option is the fastest as it is not restricted by cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you choose this option and fail to skip the 2nd Magic Onslaught, eat up and use to hopefully survive. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you choose this method and consistently fail to skip, consider trying the All-in method. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Example: https://youtu.be/p11g8eljI9o Example Kill https://youtu.be/NFtB7jfFULo Example Runs https://youtu.be/6rok3xSpR1s 11:42 by #Unknown user https://youtu.be/AzzzO^^05-Q 15:24 by #Akva https://youtu.be/5DvBhiZM3iY 17:37 (pre-gChain) by #Linie Table of Contents Introduction [Link]($linkmsg Presets [Link]($linkmsg Relevant Mob Breakdown [Link]($linkmsg First Floor - Pre-Crassian [Link]($linkmsg The Crassian Leviathan [Link]($linkmsg Post Crassian - Second Floor Entry [Link]($linkmsg Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry [Link]($linkmsg Taraket the Necromancer [Link]($linkmsg Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit [Link]($linkmsg Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador [Link]($linkmsg Kranon, the Ambassador [Link]($linkmsg Ambassador Strategy [Link]($linkmsg Example Runs [Link]($linkmsg

docs.text: Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow This guide is structured in the order that rooms would be encountered if running the dungeon. Rotations are written to utilize the Greater Chain ability and assume 4TAA is used; however, neither is required to effectively do this dungeon. Each solo run of ED3 is worth 20,363,636 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 3.5 kph, earning on average 71,272,727 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. ⬥ Luck of the Dwarves will not improve unique drop rates.

docs.text: Note: The dungeon can be effectively run with a single preset but for general speed reasons a separate preset should be used for Ambassador. Universal ⬥ Undead Slayer ability ⬥ Undead Slayer perk ⬥ Salve Amulet for undead mobs and Taraket ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ Spiritual Prayers - use with a Ripper Demon familiar. ⬥ Weapon Poison ⬥ Maniacal Aura Note: Mahjarrat Aura is also ok and makes the Taraket strategy noticeably easier to execute. Optional ⬥ A few empty inventory spaces if picking up charm drops. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elite Dungeon chest upgrade solves this issue. ⬥ Adjust food as seen fit. ⬥ Lucky Charms ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doesn't increase Eldritch drop rate. ⬥ Flanking 4 - not super impactful especially in solo. Beginner/Group ⬥ Bringing both dual-wield and 2h is optional and should be done if the player is comfortable with switching. ⬥ Guthix Staff for increased hitchance ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced Solo ⬥ Powerburst of Acceleration ⬥ Virtus Book - Caroming 4 ⬥ Undead Slayer perk - anywhere on gear ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Essence of Finality - Armadyl battlestaff ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced Solo Ambassador ⬥ Powerburst of Vitality ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for )

docs.text: As the first boss of The Shadow Reef, The Crassian Leviathan has a very small and easy set of area denial mechanics that can deal a lot of damage if ignored. The boss heals passively over the duration of the fight, largely negated with Weapon Poison active. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits + Additional Heads - The center of the arena is filled with poison and is surrounded by the additional heads of the Leviathan. Never stand here. ⬥ Dragon Breath - This will always be the first mechanic of the fight and is signaled by the Leviathan firing a stationary breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage. Stand off to the side to avoid this. ⬥ Head Sweep - The Leviathan will slam its' head across the ground twice, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area, avoided by moving to the opposite side of where the sweep begins. ⬥ After going through one Dragon Breath and two sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other opposite side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge to the opposite end of the arena. Strategy ⬥ Aim to Sunshine right away either directly in front of the Leviathan's nose or on the same tile you throw vuln bombs to (directly east of the Leviathan's head). Both spots allow for you to safely hit the boss in while avoiding the Head Sweep special. Drink your apot and look to use → . ⬥ At this point the Head Sweep will have started. Use an Guthix Staff spec either before or after you move to dodge the Head Sweep followed by a Detonate after dodging once. Get in another → → before you ends. ⬥ After your ends, try to just use thresholds to do damage up until it switches sides. If your damage doesn't look too great when you hit about the 1 minute mark, try to build to high adren to use a Metaphoris + Limitless immediately after the switch. Otherwise look to finish the boss off with more thresholds and Guthix Staff specs after the switch. Note: Leviathan switching sides counts as walking for Combust so look to use that as one of your last abilities on the initial side. ⬥ Example Kill: https://youtu.be/wdwPoXs06q0
docs.title: The Crassian Leviathan

docs.text: Room 9 Drink your Acceleration Powerburst exiting the Leviathan and utilize surge and bladed dive as demonstrated below to quickly reach this room. There is a Cloaked Zealot and various Scuttlers in this room you need to clear to proceed. gChain the Zealot and use Asphyxiate followed by Dragonbreath . If your does not hit all the Scuttlers, you may want to use Corruption Blast before . Diagonally bladed dive into the next room. Room 10 Put your salve amulet back on. In the middle of the room, tag a Zombie with gChain and charge Detonate → (tc) . Surge → bladed dive → to reach the cliff. Room 11 Jump down the cliff to clear an Ulthven Necromancer and two Huge Skeletons. Use gChain → Asphyxiate on the Necromancer to clear the entire room. Room 12 There are two Necromancers off at the sides and a line of three Armoured Zombies guarding the door. You only need to kill one Necromancer and the Zombies to proceed to section 2, the temple area. Run to the archway and surge straight before diagonally bladed diving towards a Necromancer. Kill the Necromancer with Wild Magic → Combust . Use gChain on an Armoured Zombie and charge Detonate → .
docs.title: Post-Crassian - Second Floor Entry

docs.text: Room 1 There are two Ulthven Necromancers guarding the gates to the east and west that you must clear to access the black stone artefacts. The main gate will not drop until these have been activated. A mass of summoned skeletons will form in the room as you go about this task. Equip your and surge + bladed dive down the path. Go west first and kill the Necromancer with → → . through the open barrier to go tag the artefact. diagonally back to the doorway and through. Kill the east Necromancer with → and towards the doorway. Go tag the artefact then run back and diagonally towards the bridge. Demonstrated: https://youtu.be/dGDwdi6PojI Room 2 Surge twice down the bridge to the two Sea Horrors and a Necromancer that you must clear to proceed. Use gChain → Asphyxiate → Dragonbreath on the east Horror while running to the far northeast corner. Charge Detonate on the west Horror → . The Necromancer should die to AoE during this clear but kill with basics if it suvives. Diagonally bladed dive to the next hallway afterwards. Note: It is ok to use Devotion here, but it should ideally be before reaching the Horrors. Room 3 There's a line of three Acolytes of Seiryu guarding the gate here that must be cleared to proceed. Tag the northernmost Acolyte with gChain and use Wild Magic before switching targets. Finish off the survivors with Dragonbreath and Corruption Blast . Immediately after clearing this room, drink your Acceleration Powerburst to bladed dive back to back to back as demonstrated below. Room 4 There are many mobs here but only the Necromancers and Huge Skeletons must be cleared. Put your salve amulet back on and use gChain → Asphyxiate → Dragonbreath on the western Necromancer. Finish off what's left with basics, but try not to use Corruption Blast as it will stop your from banking at the chest.
docs.title: Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry

docs.text: This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes.
docs.title: Taraket the Necromancer

docs.text: ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged. These autos are slightly stronger than his Magic ones. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity - Upon reaching 200K hitpoints, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly towards one of the two black crystals at the sides of the arena, healing himself and spawning one of the two corpses: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletal mobs as it's alive ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's attacks. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both of these attack with melee and are very easy to kite if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket can only spawn these once each and will not heal upon hitting 200K HP afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first spawn will always be the closest crystal to Taraket. ⬥ Spirit Line - Taraket smashes the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that will move towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move out of the way as needed be. Strategy ⬥ Utilizing 4TAA with Blood Barrage and gChain will make a world of difference in this fight in particular allowing players to essentially tank almost everything, especially on Mahjarrat Aura rather than Maniacal . ‎ ‎With , the last 300k can be sketchy at times; however, it is very much worth using. ⬥ Start out the fight with an apot Sunshine and your salve amulet equipped. → → → → (→ if Taraket is still above 200k hp) / the Rift → to clear the skeletons → + the Bloated Monstrosity → run back to just west of where Taraket was before flying and charge on him → → → (→ → if not phased but try to stay high adren) Note: Where you stand is important here as you're looking to body block Taraket from flying west. ⬥ Equip → on the Bloated Monstrosity and build back to 100 to back on Taraket and build with 2 basics → → → → step to the other side of Taraket before the Corpse Carrier reaches melee distance to effective stack it on top of Taraket Blocking + + Stacking Demonstrated: Note: Stacking Corpse Carrier in this way is not 100% guranteed and it is very important that you move back through Taraket to restack if it does not work. → → → → → → ( ends) ⬥ From here finish off taraket with more thresholds and . Be sure to side step the melee hits from the Spirit Line special as they will severly hurt your ability to outheal the majority of the damage you take. Also use off cooldown (preferably before thresholds or ) to improve overall healing and to repeatedly clear out the skeletal mobs the Corpse Carrier spawns. A second rift will spawn but you should be killing Taraket before it explodes so you can generally ignore it. ⬥ The Dark Form prayer is helpful here especially if using Spiritual Prayers . Note: Untested but players who do not 4TAA can likely follow this strategy up until when the Corpse Carrier spawns, at which point they would want to focus it down while in Sunshine . ⬥ Example Kill: https://youtu.be/qhA1C_HZrPQ
docs.title: Mechanics

docs.text: Note: This section and the following section can be cleared fairly easily with little to no food. As such, do not bank after Taraket even if running low. Room 5 Surge + bladed dive → out of Taraket's room. There is a Sea Witch and two Armoured Zombies in this room. Tag the Witch with gChain → Asphxyiate /Wild Magic /Guthix Staff depending on cooldowns following Taraket. into the next room. Room 6 Put back on your Essence of Finality . Only the Kalgerion Demon needs to be killed here to proceed. He's really big and impossible to miss. If you have it, the Demon Slayer ability can be used here. Guthix staff (dw) → Asphyxiate /Wild Magic should be enough. The Demon Slayer ability can be used here if you already own it. After killing the demon, look to utilize surge and bladed dive and an Acceleration Powerburst as demonstrated below. Note: You can manipulate one of the required Necromancers in room 7 to move from his position to make the next room easier on you by running as close as you can to him, so he aggros you through the wall. This isn’t 100% guaranteed. Room 7 There's two Necromancers hiding around in this room that need to be cleared. Use either Wild Magic or Guthix Staff followed by Combust on the west Necromancer then surge back towards the east Necromancer. If low on Hp or food use gChain → Asphyxiate on the east Necromancer, otherwise simply . Diagonally bladed dive through the corner into the next room and keep running to angle yourself for the next surge . Room 8 Only the two Necromancers are guarding the gate here. Kill the first Necromancer with Sonic → Guthix Staff then surge diagonally through the corner to the second Necromancer. Kill it with Wild Magic → Corruption Blast and diagonally bladed dive through the corner to the cliff.
docs.title: Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit

docs.text: Room 1 Use surge twice to reach the group of Crassian Warriors and Scuttlers around the gate that must be killed. They stack up very nicely for all AoEs and aren't very threatening in general. Tag a Warrior with gChain → Combust on your way to the barrier and charge a Detonate → → (→ → if bad ). Improvise to finish off the survivors. Room 2 There's two Warped Skeletons in here that can completely clear you if you aren't paying attention. Equip your salve amulet and gChain the two Skeletons. Proceed to Asphyxiate → (tc skeleton 2) → . Surge into the next room and immediately bladed dive behind the line of Zealots. Room 3 Re-equip your Essence of Finality and use gChain on either one of the eastern Zealots or Skeleton if close. From here use Tsunami then improvise to finish off the stragglers ideally with Detonate . Room 4 The last room before the final boss of the dungeon. There are two more skeletons along with two Crassian Scouts that need to be cleared to proceed. There are three minibosses that can spawn in this room with a fairly inconvenient aggro range so try to avoid them by hugging the western wall. Ideally look to gChain the Skeletons → Asphyxiate → Combust /Corruption Blast . Build on the Scouts to ensure you have full adren for Ambassador. Note: If no minibosses spawn in this room, look to zoom to the door and all 4 mobs.
docs.title: Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador

docs.text: At the bottom of the abyssal section awaits Kranon, the Ambassador, the final boss of the Elite Dungeon 3. This boss has a moderate learning curve compared to most solo bosses and has a variety of mechanics ranging from DPS checks, area denial, self-healing, and the usage multiple combat styles. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. Ambassador's Attack Rotation ⬥ 1M HP to 550K - Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ⬥ 550K to 400K - Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Uses the same auto attack rotation until Ritual. ⬥ Ritual - Kill ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 autos → Melee/Magic → 5 autos → Melee/Magic → Onslaught 1M-550K HP ⬥ Purple Corruption ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them at the Ritual phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the Sanctum Guardian's mechanic from ED1 but will create two areas instead, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones will last until the final phase of the fight and will ramp up to 2000 typeless damage to anyone standing inside. ⬥ Black Hole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador will spawn a black hole near the area that will explode a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Despawned by stunning it. ⬥ Sinister Fragments ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. At the same time, the Ambassador will fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Failing to destroy a fragment(s) prompts the Ambassador to absorb them, and release a hard hitting typeless explotion per fragment absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He'll use the Fragments one minute into the fight or by hitting the 650K cap. Burn! Like the ants you are. A fragment is absorbed 550K-400K HP ⬥ The Ambassador stops spawning Sinister Fragments. ⬥ The Ambassador spawns invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers that deal low ranged damage, making Resonance harder to use. 400K-0 HP ⬥ The Ambassador will stop doing his corruption and black hole mechanics, continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ⬥ Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and infested areas. ⬥ A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These will heal the boss 2500 HP for each smoke let in and can be blocked, directing a small amount of damage towards the player. Seiryu arrives Ritual begins ⬥ Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks.
docs.title: Kranon, the Ambassador

docs.text: General Tips ⬥ Use a Ripper demon with scrolls and drink Spiritual Prayers . ⬥ Try to avoid using solid food. Stick to Blue jellies , and Guthix rest or Saradomin brews , if you can. ⬥ Try to maximize the potential healing from soulsplitting Spinners and the Seiryu Heal at 400k to cut down on food usage throughout the fight. Resonance can also be used on the magic auto attack occasionally to preserve food. ⬥ You will need to Spellbook Swap to use Disruption Shield throughout the fight. Bring runes accordingly. ⬥ Flanking can be utilized throughout the fight by stepping directly underneath the Ambassador. Phase 1 - 1M-650k HP Note: Most autos and basics will be omitted in the rotations below. If either is listed below, the timing achieved is intentional. Also all Detonate are charged for 3 ticks. ⬥ Magic 1st Auto vs Melee 1st Auto ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doing → (during gcd) to reach melee distance instantly at the start of the fight will switch the 1st auto into a melee auto. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Changing the 1st auto into a melee auto changes the timing of the 1st smoke. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Mage 1st auto leads to a 22.8s (38t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Melee 1st auto leads to a 31.8s (53t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No other timings are changed. Note: The rotation in this guide assumes Magic 1st auto for timings. ⬥ Start the Fight with an Apot Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Disruption Shield while running down the ramp + → → → run to the north/northwest corner of your while waiting to auto → → (1st smoke timer will start + switch to for the 2nd magic auto) → → move out of smoke → (3rd magic auto) → → clear black hole with immediately (timer will be close to ending) ( ends) build with basics → → (2nd smoke timer starts) → (4th magic auto will come out towards the end of smoke timer) → move out of smoke → → → ⬥ Phase 1 Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Try to place the 2nd smoke next to your 1st smoke. This will put them out of the way as after spinners you will primarily stay south/southwest of Ambassador while also leaving a large path on the east side for pathing during spinners. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you switch prayers properly and the last magic auto attack, it is fairly straight forward to no food phase 1 starting from full hp. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on where the black hole spawns, you may need to start moving early to reach it in time. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Be careful that you do not stall then cancel . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Having the flanking perk equipped will cause to not clear the black hole. Phase 2 - Spinners ⬥ Spinner Strategy (not all basics listed) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1st: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 2nd: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3rd: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 4th: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5th: → basics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 6th: ignore and build on Ambassador ⬥ Spinners Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You only need to kill 5 out of 6 and then use either or to block the explosion hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No movement abilities are required to effectively move between spinners; however, if desired, it is recommended to use Bladed Dive as its cooldown will be reset by each spinner death. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Using Vulnerability bombs on each of the spinners is not necessary but recommended. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The spinners are not immune to binds and therefore Ice Barrage + Wrack can be utilized. Phase 3 - 650k-400k ⬥ Natural Instinct Sunshine → 3-4 basics → the eruption → → (5th magic auto) → (3rd smoke timer start) → → move → (6th magic auto) → → clear black hole with immediately build with basics → (7th magic auto) (if bad adren skip to not delay next ) → (dw) ⬥ Phase 3 Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you are confident in your ability to on tick, you can the 7th magic auto here to save food. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Try to end this phase on very low hp for a large heal from Seiryu but beware as flicking to to block a magic auto will still cost you somewhere around 2-3k hp. Phase 4 - Ritual (400k-0 HP) ⬥ General Strategy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking the Healing Smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Understand your character as a wedge when blocking smoke. You can always block 2 smoke directions at once so whenever you have to move, rather than moving to block the current smoke, move to block the current smoke and the next smoke . For this reason it is also more beneficial to move to melee distance for this phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively you can spam click under him to block all of the healing smoke without needing to move, though this is also the most click-intensive and difficult thing you can do. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking Magic Onslaught (from most to least ideal) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Devotion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Vitality Powerburst ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Debilitate ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Vitality Powerburst + Shield Dome Note: is very dangerous and is only to save kills following misjudgements. You should never want to use this method. Timing a for hp or using to block the 1st hit of Magic Onslaught also helps this method but adds even more risk. ⬥ Apot Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Run underneath and activate Sunshine . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This will allow you to move to block smokes while remaining in . + → → → → → → → (sun ends) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Devotion to block the Magic Onslaught Note: Very unideal but depending on the timing you may need to activate Limitless to . ⬥ Last 100k or So ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on the hp remaining, you have 3 options here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The right option is a judgement call and takes practice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Factors to consider include: hp remaining, food remaining, availability, dps, and confidence ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Safe and Slow - use a thresh or 2 then build to Sunshine → → → build (save ) + eat → → + the 2nd Magic Onslaught (may come before or after asphyx) → improvise with thresh ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option is slow as it generally will not finish the kill until some time after the 2nd Magic Onslaught; however, this option is the safest as it always has access to a safe approach to dealing with the Onslaught. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All-in for the Skip - use a thresh then build to → → → 2 basics → → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option should be fairly consistent in skipping; however, it leaves you in a bad way if you fail the skip with the only option being to resort to . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Example: https://youtu.be/sjP9TMF_0nM ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Speed - assuming hp remaining is fairly low, spam thresh and Guthix Staff EoF to kill before 2nd Magic Onslaught → → → → → improvise ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option is the fastest as it is not restricted by cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you choose this option and fail to skip the 2nd Magic Onslaught, eat up and use to hopefully survive. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you choose this method and consistently fail to skip, consider trying the All-in method. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Example: https://youtu.be/p11g8eljI9o Example Kill https://youtu.be/NFtB7jfFULo

docs.text: The shadow reef melee The Shadow Reef (Courtesy of #Evil Lucario, #Linie, & #Akva) Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow This guide is structured in the order that rooms would be encountered if running the Dungeon. Each solo run of ED3 is worth 20,363,636 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 81,454,545 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. ⬥ The Corbicula Rex perk (112 Farming) in ROoT is extremely helpful in this dungeon, as Meteor Strike is frequently used here. ⬥ Luck of the Dwarves will not improve unique drop rates. Presets Universal ⬥ Undead Slayer Ability ⬥ Undead Slayer Perk ⬥ Salve Amulet for undead mobs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Applicable to Taraket ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ Spiritual Prayers ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For use with a Ripper Demon familiar. Optional ⬥ A few empty inventory spaces if picking up charm drops. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elite Dungeon chest upgrade solves this issue. ⬥ Adjust food as seen fit. ⬥ Lucky Charms ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doesn't increase Eldritch drop rate. ⬥ Flanking 4 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Applicable to a small degree to solo runs. Beginner/Group Melee ⬥ Noxious Scythe to deal area-of-effect damage. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced/Solo Melee ⬥ Terrasaur Maul for Taraket and The Ambassador ⬥ Essence of Finality with either: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragon Battleaxe to save an inventory space. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragon Claws for good damage on Relentless procs. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Relevant Mob Breakdown Crassian Scout ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Ranged hits. Crassian Scuttler ⬥ Life Points : 9,000 ⬥ They attack with moderately damaging Melee hits. Crassian Warrior ⬥ Life Points : 22,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Cloaked Zealot ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Summon Crassian : Can spawn Crassian mobs to attack you with. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Armoured Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Ulthven Necromancer ⬥ Life Points : 16,500 ⬥ Summon Undead : Can spawn a continous horde of Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Huge Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Sea Horror ⬥ Life Points : 35,500 ⬥ Scream : A 2,000 typeless hit used at melee distance. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. Enlightened Sotapanna ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with melee abilities for moderate damage. Undead Witch ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with a delayed, highly damaging Magic hit. Kal'gerion Demon ⬥ Life Points : 33,700 ⬥ Life Drain : Reduces your Constitution level by 2 ⬥ Demonic Ritual : Reduces all combat stats alongside rapid magic damage to anyone in range. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits otherwise. Warped Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Frenzy : Rapid 3,000 magic hits that also heal the Skeleton. Triggers are unknown. ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. First Floor - Pre Crassian Room 1 GBarge the eastern crassian scout and bleed Assault on it. Move to the spot two squares north of the other scout and Hurricane , hitting all four enemies. Finish off with Cleave → Quake . Room 2 Use GFlurry on the scouts, hitting as much scuttlers and scouts as possible. Finish with Cleave → Hurricane . Room 3 Move to the center of the cluster and Meteor Strike . Cleave → Quake should finish the job afterwards Room 4 Use Hurricane , GFlurry , and Quake on the Zealots to kill them. How to cut the corner: Room 5 There are two Crassian Scouts and two Cloaked Zealots spaced apart here. Line up your Cleave , Hurricane , and Quake to hit everything in one go. You only need to kill the two Scouts and Zealots to move to the next room. Room 6 ⬥ Hit the first group with Cleave then keep running past while putting on your salve amulet. ⬥ Quake the second group, then run back to the middle to lure both groups of zombies next to you. ⬥ Hurricane and finish off the rest with Bladed Dive (with Laceration boots) and GFlurry . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have it available, Meteor Strike is good but you likely won’t have it back in time. Room 7 GBarge a zombie, Cleave , then target the 20k armored zombie and bleed Assault on it. Then run back to the zombie you used Barge on and AoE with what you have available. Room 8 You only need to kill the two Zealots here to proceed. Use GFlurry and Cleave and prepare your gear for the next boss, watching your adrenaline and amulets. The Crassian Leviathan As the first boss of The Shadow Reef, The Crassian Leviathan has a very small and easy set of area denial mechanics that can deal a lot of damage if ignored. The boss heals passively over the duration of the fight, largely negated with Weapon Poison active. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits + Additional Heads - The center of the arena is filled with poison and is surrounded by the additional heads of the Leviathan. Never stand here. ⬥ Dragon Breath - This will always be the first mechanic of the fight and is signaled by the Leviathan firing a stationary breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage. Stand off to the side to avoid this. ⬥ Head Sweep - The Leviathan will slam its' head across the ground twice, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area, avoided by moving to the opposite side of where the sweep begins. ⬥ After going through one Dragon Breath and two sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other opposite side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge to the opposite end of the arena. Strategy For whatever reason, the Crassian Leviathan actually has decent defense so beware if not using Berserker . Both strategies utilize channeled abilities and spamclicking the ground to stay on 2 specific "safe tiles" on either side of Crass's head during the Dragon Breath and Head Sweep mechanics. ‎ ‎If used correctly, you do not need a scythe to melee this boss. ⬥ Standard 1 Cycle Your target is to pop Berserk and ZGS spec during the fight to finish him. + → → bleed → → (3 hit) → → → → (2-3 hit) ⬥ 2 Zerk 1 Cycle Slower but potentially more consistent than the standard rotation -- your objective is to use gFlurry to reduce the cooldown of Berserk , allowing for 2 s in the roughly 1:10 time frame. This rotation does not work if you do not have Limitless . + → → bleed → → (3 hit) → → ( if good adren) → (4 hit) → → 188 → bleed → 2 188s (1 if impatient proc) → / depending on HP Note: With this rotation, you are looking to the second time as soon as it comes off cooldown. Post-Crassian - Second Floor Entry Room 9 There is a Cloaked Zealot and various Scuttlers in this room you need to clear to proceed. GBarge one of the scouts for both the Barge buff and faster movement. Bleed Assault on the zealot, then immediately target a Scuttler to Hurricane and Quake . Room 10 Wait for them to MD you and use Meteor Strike with a few AoEs. Room 11 Run down a long path and jump down the cliff to clear an Ulthven Necromancer and two Huge Skeletons. There's not much to this room but focusing the necromancer will clear the skeletons in the AoE available. Save the following abilities for next Room: Cleave and GFlurry Room 12 Kill one of the Necromancers with a walked Slaughter → Decimate . Then quickly move to the zombies guarding the entrance to the temple itself. Cleave and GFlurry the zombies, then finish off with good basics. Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry Room 1 ⬥ Go to either necromancer and GBarge (with Mobile) → Assault . ⬥ Kill that necromancer and activate the artifact, ⬥ Go to the other necromancer and GBarge (with Mobile again) → GFlurry , then activate the artifact. Room 2 ⬥ Use Devotion right as you start moving into the bridge and Bladed Dive + Surge to the end immediately mid-GCD, ⬥ GBarge one of the sea horrors. ⬥ Bleed Assault on it, then target the necromancer to Hurricane . ⬥ Cleave → Quake the horror you didn’t attack to kill both the first horror and the necromancer. ⬥ Finish off the horror with other strong basics to proceed. Room 3 There's a line of three Acolytes of Seiryu guarding the gate here that must be cleared to proceed. They are melee and line up well for AoEs. Room 4 ⬥ Bladed Dive + Surge through the staircase as marked to avoid aggroing the four acolytes ⬥ Go all the way to the next gate. There are many mobs here but only the necromancers and Huge Skeletons must be cleared. ⬥ Start with a Meteor Strike and finish off all the mobs with other AoE abilities, but make sure to have high adrenaline as the next room is the second boss, Taraket the Necromancer. Taraket the Necromancer This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes. Mechanics ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged. These autos are slightly stronger than his Magic ones. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity - Upon reaching 200K hitpoints, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly towards one of the two black crystals at the sides of the arena, healing himself and spawning one of the two corpses: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletal mobs as it's alive ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's attacks. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both of these attack with melee and are very easy to kite if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket can only spawn these once each and will not heal upon hitting 200K HP afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first spawn will always be the closest crystal to Taraket. ⬥ Spirit Line - Taraket smashes the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that will move towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move out of the way as needed be. Strategy There are three different methods to this: Killing both bloats for maximum safety, killing only the Corpse carrier immediately to balance safety with speed, and just DPSing Taraket and tanking both bloats. What you do will slightly affect your rotation, but the overall goals remain the same. ⬥ Opener ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserk to GBarge . and don't use Adrenaline Potions immediately as you’d want to save it for later. Instead, just use to get your thresholds off. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you were quick and started the fight while you still have your Meteor Strike buff from the previous room, the amount of adrenaline you will gain from critical hits will let you go bleed Assault → ‎ ‎ (3 hit) → Destroy for the most optimal DPS rotation without an adrenaline potion. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dump the rest of your strong basics and the portal should spawn right before Taraket phases. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Activate Undead Slayer right when you use your next ability after Assault. Safety V Speed ⬥ ZGS on Taraket (the best way) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• GBarge as soon as he’s available to be hit with dual wield ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Swap to ZGS to spec ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Swap to your Maul to get a lossless 2h auto for high damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleed Assault , saving Hurricane right before the 200k mark. ⬥ Killing the Corpse Carrier instantly, (slower, but much safer) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• GBarge → GFlurry ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Slaughter to Meteor Strike as more skeletons spawn from the corpse carrier for maximum adrenaline refunds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Right after it’s dead, use Berserk → GBarge + Adren Pot ‎ ‎ → bleed Thresholds and finish Taraket off. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use ZGS spec after your Berserk wears. Activate your Undead Slayer under Berserk ⬥ Ignoring the Corpse Carrier (Riskier and much faster) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserk → GBarge immediately when Taraket can be damaged again and simply outeat everything. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is extremely risky, but can be done fairly well even with blubbers and Guthix rests. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As your ZGS spec will still be on cooldown, finish off the rest of the kill with strong Basics and Thresholds. Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit Room 5 ⬥ There is a Sea Witch and two Armoured Zombies in this room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge behind the Sea Witch, traping the skeletons behind the witch and cleave down with Scythe. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Don't use Assault because you’ll want to save it for the next room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Beware of delayed Sea Witch's magic auto attack after killing it. ⬥ Setting up Necromancer lure in room 7: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Check your minimap to see if the skeleton is at the southern wall. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It can be aggroed from any tile on that wall except for the southeastern corner. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge into room 6 towards the wall sticking to the rocks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This will aggro the skeleton and chain aggro the necromancer with it. Room 6 Only the Kalgerion Demon needs to be killed here to proceed. He's really big and impossible to miss, activate Demon Slayer and GBarge → Assault the Kal’gerion demon. Finish off with more strong basics and thresholds. If the skeleton in room 7 was not aggroed while you were in room 6, you can aggro it here. Room 7 There's two necromancers hiding around in this room that need to be cleared. Dump some thresholds and proceed. If you aggroed the far necromancer from the previous rooms, it should be coming towards you as you come up to the corridor. GBarge the necromancer coming towards you, bleed the other, then finish off the first one with thresholds. Room 8 Another two Necromancers are guarding the gate here so just continue picking them off. The Sea Witches and Magister miniboss that can spawn at the east side of the room have a fairly large aggro range so preferably hug the wall as you enter. Use Quake and Decimate the first Necromancer immediately. Slaughter and Surge at the exact same time to finish it off and move yourself quickly through the dungeon. Get on the other necromancer and finish it off with strong abilities. Finally, dive into the abyss to enter the final section of the dungeon. Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador Room 1 Move to the gate and GBarge a Crassian warrior. Bleed Assault on it, and let the rest of the warriors gather to you, then finish them off with AoE's. Save Meteor Strike for Room 3. Room 2 Two Warped Skeletons in here that can completely clear you if you aren't paying attention. The skeletons can deal a moderate mage hit frequently, healing themselves while dealing 2000-3000 damage to you, be careful. Room 3 Use Meteor Strike and AoE the enemies all in one go and finish off the rest of the mobs however you see fit. Room 4 The last room before the final boss of the dungeon. There are two more skeletons along with two Crassian Scouts that need to be cleared to proceed. They're pretty spread out so just dps and make sure to be on high adrenaline for the encounter with The Ambassador. There are three minibosses that can spawn in this room with a fairly inconvenient aggro range so avoid them by quickly Bladed Dive + Surging . GBarge the Crassian Scouts and finish off the rest of the mobs, but try not to use Assault so you can more quickly use it for the start of Ambassador if you don’t want to wait. Kranon, the Ambassador At the bottom of the abyssal section awaits the Ambassador, the final boss of the Elite Dungeon 3. This boss has a moderate learning curve compared to most solo bosses and has a variety of mechanics ranging from DPS checks, area denial, and self-healing, as well as utilizing multiple combat styles. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. Ambassador's Attack Rotation ⬥ 1M HP to 550K - Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ⬥ 550K to 400K - Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Uses the same auto attack rotation until Ritual. ⬥ Ritual - Kill ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 autos → Melee/Magic → 5 autos → Melee/Magic → Onslaught 1M-550K HP ⬥ Purple Corruption ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them at the Ritual phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the Sanctum Guardian's mechanic from ED1 but will create two areas instead, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones will last until the final phase of the fight and will ramp up to 2000 typeless damage to anyone standing inside. ⬥ Black Hole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador will spawn a black hole near the area that will explode a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Despawned by stunning it. ⬥ Sinister Fragments ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. At the same time, the Ambassador will fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Failing to destroy a fragment(s) prompts the Ambassador to absorb them, and release a hard hitting typeless explotion per fragment absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He'll use the Fragments one minute into the fight or by hitting the 650K cap. *Burn! Like the ants you are! A fragment is absorbed 550K-400K HP ⬥ The Ambassador stops spawning Sinister Fragments. ⬥ The Ambassador spawns invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers that deal low ranged damage, making Resonance harder to use. 400K-0 HP ⬥ The Ambassador will stop doing his corruption and black hole mechanics, continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ⬥ Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and infested areas. ⬥ A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These will heal the boss 2500 HP for each smoke let in and can be blocked, directing a small amount of damage towards the player. Seiryu arrives Ritual begins ⬥ Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks. Ambassador Strategy General Tips ⬥ Use a Ripper demon with scrolls and drink Spiritual Prayers . ⬥ Berserker Aura is ideal. Otherwise Mahjarrat Aura is also ok. ⬥ If you have TMW , try to avoid using solid food. Stick to Blue jellies , Guthix rest , and Saradomin brews . ⬥ Try to maximize the potential healing from soulsplitting Spinners and the Seiryu Heal at 400k to cut down on food usage throughout the fight. Phase 1 - 1M-650k HP Your main goal P1 is to maximize your time spent in melee distance doing damage to Ambassador. ⬥ Start the fight with an Apot Berserk rotation . + → → bleed → → (3 hit) ⬥ Mage 1st Auto vs Melee 1st Auto ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doing → (during gcd) → will switch the 1st auto into a melee auto. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Changing the 1st auto into a melee auto changes the timing of the 1st smoke. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Mage 1st auto leads to a 22.8s (38t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Melee 1st auto leads to a 31.8s (53t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No other timings are changed. Note: The rotation in this guide assumes Mage 1st auto for timings. ⬥ 1st Smoke → → place smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Place the 1st smoke in melee distance northeast of Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If north is 12 on a clock, you want to place the 1st smoke at 2. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If looking to utilize walk under flank , you should place this smoke 1 square out of md to keep underneath free of smoke. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After placing the smoke, run through Ambassador and Zgs . Note: Placing this smoke far is an option; however, it is only recommended if you are not confident in your ability to avoid a 2nd set of Spinners. ⬥ Black Hole → → black hole → clear black hole → back to Ambassador → → (2-3 hit) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The recommended strategy for clearing the black hole is to Bladed Dive on gcd to the black hole, clear it with Backhand , then on gcd again back to Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively, the black hole can be tanked with Reprisal for a source of damage, especially in TMW . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Tanking with is not recommended as the adren is generally better spent on other thresholds. ⬥ 2nd Smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This smoke should be placed far. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Ideally place this smoke with Escape to maximize DPS time. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Feel free to run back to Ambassador after placing if you have not phased, but Do Not use gBarge and ideally do not use Destroy /Hurricane . Phase 2 - Spinners Ideally, Bladed Dive should be used to travel between spinners as killing a spinner will reset Bladed Dive cooldown. You only need to kill 5 out of 6 and then use either or to block the explosion hit. ⬥ Basic but Solid Spinner Strategy (not all basics listed) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1st: → bleed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 2nd: (2-3 hit) → 188s ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3rd: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 4th: lunge → → 188s ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively can → → 188s ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5th: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 6th: (2-3 hit) → 188s ⬥ Advanced Spinner Strategy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To min-max damage against Ambassador, use Meteor Strike on the third fragment. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Once you get back to 100% adrenaline, use Natural Instinct on the fifth fragment and build back to 100% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use dragon battleaxe spec and once again build back up to 100% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Before Ambassador absorbs fragments, you may use on Ambassador himself to squeeze in a bit more damage after fragments. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Keep in mind that during this time, you essentially can only use basics so destroying all of the fragments is made much harder, so you only destroy five out of six. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can use Vulnerability Bombs to aid in clearing any spinners you face challenges with. Phase 3 - 650k-400k ⬥ After Spinners, do a Limitless Berserk rotation . → → 2 188s → bleed → 1 188 → (2 hit) → → 3rd smoke Note: Rotation requires the Fury of the Small relic . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5/6 spinners killed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If choosing to the explosion, go ahead and right away then at the correct time. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If choosing to the explosion, delay your until after blocking the explosion. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Apot Berserk vs Limitless Berserk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you phase P1 early (reaching 650k before 1 min), you will not have Apot off cooldown for this . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For players who have trouble skipping the 2nd set of Spinners, it is recommended to do an rotation here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Players who do not have trouble with this skip can still opt for an here; however, with future improvement in mind, it is recommended to instead learn and utilize a here as you will not need to change your rotation later. ⬥ 3rd Smoke place smoke → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Place the 3rd smoke in melee distance southeast of Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Move up close to the smoke you already placed while remaining in md to place. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If north is 12 on a clock, you want to place the this smoke at 6. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do Not attempt to walk under flank after placing this smoke as underneath will likely not be safe until later. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After placing the smoke, run to the west and Zgs . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ritual keepers should spawn very quickly. Ignore them. ⬥ Black Hole black hole → clear black hole → back to Ambassador → → → (2-3 hit) → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The recommended strategy for clearing the black hole is to Bladed Dive on gcd to the black hole, clear it with Backhand , then on gcd again back to Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively, the black hole can be tanked with Reprisal for a source of damage, especially in TMW . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Tanking with is not recommended as the adren is generally better spent on other thresholds. Note: Your timing here is very important to the overall speed of your kill as it will dictate when you can next then when you can after. ⬥ 4th Smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on gear/aura/experience/DPS, some players will get this whereas others will skip. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you do not skip it, place it far ideally with Escape . Phase 4 - Ritual (400k-0 HP) ⬥ General Strategy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rotate Berserk and ZGS between Magic Onslaughts → Magic Onslaught → → Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Block the healing smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Understand your character as a wedge when blocking smoke. You can always block 2 smoke directions at once so whenever you have to move, rather than moving to block the current smoke, move to block the current smoke and the next smoke . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively you can spam click under him to block all of the healing smoke without needing to move, though this is also the most click-intensive and difficult thing you can do. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Devotion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Vitality Powerburst ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Debilitate ⬥ P4 Rotation + → → bleed → → (3 hit) → → Magic Onslaught → → / depending on HP → improvise Note: may come off cd around the time of the 1st Magic Onslaught. Pay attention and it may save a few gcd on fast kills. Example Kill (Courtesy of #Akva) https://youtu.be/6WiH_K0W-CU Example Runs https://youtu.be/sVGhTNvWvbM 13:30 by #Evil Lucario https://youtu.be/4EKn6uNwIh0 13:13 by #couchy Table of Contents Introduction [Link]($linkmsg Presets [Link]($linkmsg Relevant Mob Breakdown [Link]($linkmsg First Floor - Pre-Crassian [Link]($linkmsg The Crassian Leviathan [Link]($linkmsg Post Crassian - Second Floor Entry [Link]($linkmsg Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry [Link]($linkmsg Taraket the Necromancer [Link]($linkmsg Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit [Link]($linkmsg Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador [Link]($linkmsg Kranon, the Ambassador [Link]($linkmsg Ambassador Strategy [Link]($linkmsg Example Runs [Link]($linkmsg
