docs.text: Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow This guide is structured in the order that rooms would be encountered if running the Dungeon. Each solo run of ED3 is worth 20,363,636 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 81,454,545 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. ⬥ The Corbicula Rex perk (112 Farming) in ROoT is extremely helpful in this dungeon, as Meteor Strike is frequently used here. ⬥ Luck of the Dwarves will not improve unique drop rates.

Optional ⬥ A few empty inventory spaces if picking up charm drops. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elite Dungeon chest upgrade solves this issue. ⬥ Adjust food as seen fit. ⬥ Lucky Charms ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doesn't increase Eldritch drop rate. ⬥ Flanking 4 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Applicable to a small degree to solo runs. Beginner/Group Melee ⬥ Noxious Scythe to deal area-of-effect damage. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced/Solo Melee ⬥ Terrasaur Maul for Taraket and The Ambassador ⬥ Essence of Finality with either: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragon Battleaxe to save an inventory space. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragon Claws for good damage on Relentless procs. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for )

docs.text: Room 1 GBarge the eastern crassian scout and bleed Assault on it. Move to the spot two squares north of the other scout and Hurricane , hitting all four enemies. Finish off with Cleave → Quake . Room 2 Use GFlurry on the scouts, hitting as much scuttlers and scouts as possible. Finish with Cleave → Hurricane . Room 3 Move to the center of the cluster and Meteor Strike . Cleave → Quake should finish the job afterwards Room 4 Use Hurricane , GFlurry , and Quake on the Zealots to kill them. How to cut the corner: Room 5 There are two Crassian Scouts and two Cloaked Zealots spaced apart here. Line up your Cleave , Hurricane , and Quake to hit everything in one go. You only need to kill the two Scouts and Zealots to move to the next room. Room 6 ⬥ Hit the first group with Cleave then keep running past while putting on your salve amulet. ⬥ Quake the second group, then run back to the middle to lure both groups of zombies next to you. ⬥ Hurricane and finish off the rest with Bladed Dive (with Laceration boots) and GFlurry . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have it available, Meteor Strike is good but you likely won’t have it back in time. Room 7 GBarge a zombie, Cleave , then target the 20k armored zombie and bleed Assault on it. Then run back to the zombie you used Barge on and AoE with what you have available. Room 8 You only need to kill the two Zealots here to proceed. Use GFlurry and Cleave and prepare your gear for the next boss, watching your adrenaline and amulets.

docs.text: As the first boss of The Shadow Reef, The Crassian Leviathan has a very small and easy set of area denial mechanics that can deal a lot of damage if ignored. The boss heals passively over the duration of the fight, largely negated with Weapon Poison active. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits + Additional Heads - The center of the arena is filled with poison and is surrounded by the additional heads of the Leviathan. Never stand here. ⬥ Dragon Breath - This will always be the first mechanic of the fight and is signaled by the Leviathan firing a stationary breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage. Stand off to the side to avoid this. ⬥ Head Sweep - The Leviathan will slam its' head across the ground twice, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area, avoided by moving to the opposite side of where the sweep begins. ⬥ After going through one Dragon Breath and two sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other opposite side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge to the opposite end of the arena. Strategy For whatever reason, the Crassian Leviathan actually has decent defense so beware if not using Berserker . Both strategies utilize channeled abilities and spamclicking the ground to stay on 2 specific "safe tiles" on either side of Crass's head during the Dragon Breath and Head Sweep mechanics. ‎ ‎If used correctly, you do not need a scythe to melee this boss. ⬥ Standard 1 Cycle Your target is to pop Berserk and ZGS spec during the fight to finish him. + → → bleed → → (3 hit) → → → → (2-3 hit) ⬥ 2 Zerk 1 Cycle Slower but potentially more consistent than the standard rotation -- your objective is to use gFlurry to reduce the cooldown of Berserk , allowing for 2 s in the roughly 1:10 time frame. This rotation does not work if you do not have Limitless . + → → bleed → → (3 hit) → → ( if good adren) → (4 hit) → → 188 → bleed → 2 188s (1 if impatient proc) → / depending on HP Note: With this rotation, you are looking to the second time as soon as it comes off cooldown.
docs.title: The Crassian Leviathan

docs.text: Room 9 There is a Cloaked Zealot and various Scuttlers in this room you need to clear to proceed. GBarge one of the scouts for both the Barge buff and faster movement. Bleed Assault on the zealot, then immediately target a Scuttler to Hurricane and Quake . Room 10 Wait for them to MD you and use Meteor Strike with a few AoEs. Room 11 Run down a long path and jump down the cliff to clear an Ulthven Necromancer and two Huge Skeletons. There's not much to this room but focusing the necromancer will clear the skeletons in the AoE available. Save the following abilities for next Room: Cleave and GFlurry Room 12 Kill one of the Necromancers with a walked Slaughter → Decimate . Then quickly move to the zombies guarding the entrance to the temple itself. Cleave and GFlurry the zombies, then finish off with good basics.
docs.title: Post-Crassian - Second Floor Entry

docs.text: Room 1 ⬥ Go to either necromancer and GBarge (with Mobile) → Assault . ⬥ Kill that necromancer and activate the artifact, ⬥ Go to the other necromancer and GBarge (with Mobile again) → GFlurry , then activate the artifact. Room 2 ⬥ Use Devotion right as you start moving into the bridge and Bladed Dive + Surge to the end immediately mid-GCD, ⬥ GBarge one of the sea horrors. ⬥ Bleed Assault on it, then target the necromancer to Hurricane . ⬥ Cleave → Quake the horror you didn’t attack to kill both the first horror and the necromancer. ⬥ Finish off the horror with other strong basics to proceed. Room 3 There's a line of three Acolytes of Seiryu guarding the gate here that must be cleared to proceed. They are melee and line up well for AoEs. Room 4 ⬥ Bladed Dive + Surge through the staircase as marked to avoid aggroing the four acolytes ⬥ Go all the way to the next gate. There are many mobs here but only the necromancers and Huge Skeletons must be cleared. ⬥ Start with a Meteor Strike and finish off all the mobs with other AoE abilities, but make sure to have high adrenaline as the next room is the second boss, Taraket the Necromancer.
docs.title: Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry

docs.text: This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes.
docs.title: Taraket the Necromancer

docs.text: ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged. These autos are slightly stronger than his Magic ones. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity - Upon reaching 200K hitpoints, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly towards one of the two black crystals at the sides of the arena, healing himself and spawning one of the two corpses: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletal mobs as it's alive ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's attacks. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both of these attack with melee and are very easy to kite if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket can only spawn these once each and will not heal upon hitting 200K HP afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first spawn will always be the closest crystal to Taraket. ⬥ Spirit Line - Taraket smashes the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that will move towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move out of the way as needed be. Strategy There are three different methods to this: Killing both bloats for maximum safety, killing only the Corpse carrier immediately to balance safety with speed, and just DPSing Taraket and tanking both bloats. What you do will slightly affect your rotation, but the overall goals remain the same. ⬥ Opener ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserk to GBarge . and don't use Adrenaline Potions immediately as you’d want to save it for later. Instead, just use to get your thresholds off. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you were quick and started the fight while you still have your Meteor Strike buff from the previous room, the amount of adrenaline you will gain from critical hits will let you go bleed Assault → ‎ ‎ (3 hit) → Destroy for the most optimal DPS rotation without an adrenaline potion. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dump the rest of your strong basics and the portal should spawn right before Taraket phases. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Activate Undead Slayer right when you use your next ability after Assault. Safety V Speed ⬥ ZGS on Taraket (the best way) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• GBarge as soon as he’s available to be hit with dual wield ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Swap to ZGS to spec ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Swap to your Maul to get a lossless 2h auto for high damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleed Assault , saving Hurricane right before the 200k mark. ⬥ Killing the Corpse Carrier instantly, (slower, but much safer) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• GBarge → GFlurry ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Slaughter to Meteor Strike as more skeletons spawn from the corpse carrier for maximum adrenaline refunds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Right after it’s dead, use Berserk → GBarge + Adren Pot ‎ ‎ → bleed Thresholds and finish Taraket off. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use ZGS spec after your Berserk wears. Activate your Undead Slayer under Berserk ⬥ Ignoring the Corpse Carrier (Riskier and much faster) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserk → GBarge immediately when Taraket can be damaged again and simply outeat everything. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is extremely risky, but can be done fairly well even with blubbers and Guthix rests. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As your ZGS spec will still be on cooldown, finish off the rest of the kill with strong Basics and Thresholds.
docs.title: Mechanics

docs.text: Room 5 ⬥ There is a Sea Witch and two Armoured Zombies in this room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge behind the Sea Witch, traping the skeletons behind the witch and cleave down with Scythe. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Don't use Assault because you’ll want to save it for the next room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Beware of delayed Sea Witch's magic auto attack after killing it. ⬥ Setting up Necromancer lure in room 7: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Check your minimap to see if the skeleton is at the southern wall. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It can be aggroed from any tile on that wall except for the southeastern corner. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge into room 6 towards the wall sticking to the rocks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This will aggro the skeleton and chain aggro the necromancer with it. Room 6 Only the Kalgerion Demon needs to be killed here to proceed. He's really big and impossible to miss, activate Demon Slayer and GBarge → Assault the Kal’gerion demon. Finish off with more strong basics and thresholds. If the skeleton in room 7 was not aggroed while you were in room 6, you can aggro it here. Room 7 There's two necromancers hiding around in this room that need to be cleared. Dump some thresholds and proceed. If you aggroed the far necromancer from the previous rooms, it should be coming towards you as you come up to the corridor. GBarge the necromancer coming towards you, bleed the other, then finish off the first one with thresholds. Room 8 Another two Necromancers are guarding the gate here so just continue picking them off. The Sea Witches and Magister miniboss that can spawn at the east side of the room have a fairly large aggro range so preferably hug the wall as you enter. Use Quake and Decimate the first Necromancer immediately. Slaughter and Surge at the exact same time to finish it off and move yourself quickly through the dungeon. Get on the other necromancer and finish it off with strong abilities. Finally, dive into the abyss to enter the final section of the dungeon.
docs.title: Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit

docs.text: Room 1 Move to the gate and GBarge a Crassian warrior. Bleed Assault on it, and let the rest of the warriors gather to you, then finish them off with AoE's. Save Meteor Strike for Room 3. Room 2 Two Warped Skeletons in here that can completely clear you if you aren't paying attention. The skeletons can deal a moderate mage hit frequently, healing themselves while dealing 2000-3000 damage to you, be careful. Room 3 Use Meteor Strike and AoE the enemies all in one go and finish off the rest of the mobs however you see fit. Room 4 The last room before the final boss of the dungeon. There are two more skeletons along with two Crassian Scouts that need to be cleared to proceed. They're pretty spread out so just dps and make sure to be on high adrenaline for the encounter with The Ambassador. There are three minibosses that can spawn in this room with a fairly inconvenient aggro range so avoid them by quickly Bladed Dive + Surging . GBarge the Crassian Scouts and finish off the rest of the mobs, but try not to use Assault so you can more quickly use it for the start of Ambassador if you don’t want to wait.
docs.title: Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador

docs.text: At the bottom of the abyssal section awaits the Ambassador, the final boss of the Elite Dungeon 3. This boss has a moderate learning curve compared to most solo bosses and has a variety of mechanics ranging from DPS checks, area denial, and self-healing, as well as utilizing multiple combat styles. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. Ambassador's Attack Rotation ⬥ 1M HP to 550K - Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ⬥ 550K to 400K - Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Uses the same auto attack rotation until Ritual. ⬥ Ritual - Kill ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 autos → Melee/Magic → 5 autos → Melee/Magic → Onslaught 1M-550K HP ⬥ Purple Corruption ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them at the Ritual phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the Sanctum Guardian's mechanic from ED1 but will create two areas instead, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones will last until the final phase of the fight and will ramp up to 2000 typeless damage to anyone standing inside. ⬥ Black Hole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador will spawn a black hole near the area that will explode a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Despawned by stunning it. ⬥ Sinister Fragments ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. At the same time, the Ambassador will fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Failing to destroy a fragment(s) prompts the Ambassador to absorb them, and release a hard hitting typeless explotion per fragment absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He'll use the Fragments one minute into the fight or by hitting the 650K cap. *Burn! Like the ants you are! A fragment is absorbed 550K-400K HP ⬥ The Ambassador stops spawning Sinister Fragments. ⬥ The Ambassador spawns invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers that deal low ranged damage, making Resonance harder to use. 400K-0 HP ⬥ The Ambassador will stop doing his corruption and black hole mechanics, continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ⬥ Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and infested areas. ⬥ A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These will heal the boss 2500 HP for each smoke let in and can be blocked, directing a small amount of damage towards the player. Seiryu arrives Ritual begins ⬥ Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks.
docs.title: Kranon, the Ambassador

docs.text: General Tips ⬥ Use a Ripper demon with scrolls and drink Spiritual Prayers . ⬥ Berserker Aura is ideal. Otherwise Mahjarrat Aura is also ok. ⬥ If you have TMW , try to avoid using solid food. Stick to Blue jellies , Guthix rest , and Saradomin brews . ⬥ Try to maximize the potential healing from soulsplitting Spinners and the Seiryu Heal at 400k to cut down on food usage throughout the fight. Phase 1 - 1M-650k HP Your main goal P1 is to maximize your time spent in melee distance doing damage to Ambassador. ⬥ Start the fight with an Apot Berserk rotation . + → → bleed → → (3 hit) ⬥ Mage 1st Auto vs Melee 1st Auto ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doing → (during gcd) → will switch the 1st auto into a melee auto. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Changing the 1st auto into a melee auto changes the timing of the 1st smoke. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Mage 1st auto leads to a 22.8s (38t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Melee 1st auto leads to a 31.8s (53t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No other timings are changed. Note: The rotation in this guide assumes Mage 1st auto for timings. ⬥ 1st Smoke → → place smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Place the 1st smoke in melee distance northeast of Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If north is 12 on a clock, you want to place the 1st smoke at 2. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If looking to utilize walk under flank , you should place this smoke 1 square out of md to keep underneath free of smoke. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After placing the smoke, run through Ambassador and Zgs . Note: Placing this smoke far is an option; however, it is only recommended if you are not confident in your ability to avoid a 2nd set of Spinners. ⬥ Black Hole → → black hole → clear black hole → back to Ambassador → → (2-3 hit) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The recommended strategy for clearing the black hole is to Bladed Dive on gcd to the black hole, clear it with Backhand , then on gcd again back to Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively, the black hole can be tanked with Reprisal for a source of damage, especially in TMW . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Tanking with is not recommended as the adren is generally better spent on other thresholds. ⬥ 2nd Smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This smoke should be placed far. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Ideally place this smoke with Escape to maximize DPS time. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Feel free to run back to Ambassador after placing if you have not phased, but Do Not use gBarge and ideally do not use Destroy /Hurricane . Phase 2 - Spinners Ideally, Bladed Dive should be used to travel between spinners as killing a spinner will reset Bladed Dive cooldown. You only need to kill 5 out of 6 and then use either or to block the explosion hit. ⬥ Basic but Solid Spinner Strategy (not all basics listed) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1st: → bleed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 2nd: (2-3 hit) → 188s ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3rd: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 4th: lunge → → 188s ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively can → → 188s ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5th: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 6th: (2-3 hit) → 188s ⬥ Advanced Spinner Strategy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To min-max damage against Ambassador, use Meteor Strike on the third fragment. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Once you get back to 100% adrenaline, use Natural Instinct on the fifth fragment and build back to 100% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use dragon battleaxe spec and once again build back up to 100% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Before Ambassador absorbs fragments, you may use on Ambassador himself to squeeze in a bit more damage after fragments. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Keep in mind that during this time, you essentially can only use basics so destroying all of the fragments is made much harder, so you only destroy five out of six. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can use Vulnerability Bombs to aid in clearing any spinners you face challenges with. Phase 3 - 650k-400k ⬥ After Spinners, do a Limitless Berserk rotation . → → 2 188s → bleed → 1 188 → (2 hit) → → 3rd smoke Note: Rotation requires the Fury of the Small relic . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5/6 spinners killed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If choosing to the explosion, go ahead and right away then at the correct time. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If choosing to the explosion, delay your until after blocking the explosion. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Apot Berserk vs Limitless Berserk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you phase P1 early (reaching 650k before 1 min), you will not have Apot off cooldown for this . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For players who have trouble skipping the 2nd set of Spinners, it is recommended to do an rotation here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Players who do not have trouble with this skip can still opt for an here; however, with future improvement in mind, it is recommended to instead learn and utilize a here as you will not need to change your rotation later. ⬥ 3rd Smoke place smoke → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Place the 3rd smoke in melee distance southeast of Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Move up close to the smoke you already placed while remaining in md to place. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If north is 12 on a clock, you want to place the this smoke at 6. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do Not attempt to walk under flank after placing this smoke as underneath will likely not be safe until later. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After placing the smoke, run to the west and Zgs . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ritual keepers should spawn very quickly. Ignore them. ⬥ Black Hole black hole → clear black hole → back to Ambassador → → → (2-3 hit) → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The recommended strategy for clearing the black hole is to Bladed Dive on gcd to the black hole, clear it with Backhand , then on gcd again back to Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively, the black hole can be tanked with Reprisal for a source of damage, especially in TMW . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Tanking with is not recommended as the adren is generally better spent on other thresholds. Note: Your timing here is very important to the overall speed of your kill as it will dictate when you can next then when you can after. ⬥ 4th Smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on gear/aura/experience/DPS, some players will get this whereas others will skip. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you do not skip it, place it far ideally with Escape . Phase 4 - Ritual (400k-0 HP) ⬥ General Strategy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rotate Berserk and ZGS between Magic Onslaughts → Magic Onslaught → → Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Block the healing smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Understand your character as a wedge when blocking smoke. You can always block 2 smoke directions at once so whenever you have to move, rather than moving to block the current smoke, move to block the current smoke and the next smoke . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively you can spam click under him to block all of the healing smoke without needing to move, though this is also the most click-intensive and difficult thing you can do. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Devotion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Vitality Powerburst ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Debilitate ⬥ P4 Rotation + → → bleed → → (3 hit) → → Magic Onslaught → → / depending on HP → improvise Note: may come off cd around the time of the 1st Magic Onslaught. Pay attention and it may save a few gcd on fast kills. Example Kill (Courtesy of #Akva) https://youtu.be/6WiH_K0W-CU

docs.text: The shadow reef ranged The Shadow Reef (Courtesy of #Pernix) Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow . Each solo run of ED3 is worth 20,363,636 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 81,454,545 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. Disclaimer: The GIFs for boss mechanic descriptions were done under Story Mode. Presets Preset Notes ⬥ Two presets are sufficient for the Reef, the second one is for The Ambassador, as Vitality and Flanking are used for the fight. ⬥ Reckless is the best aura for the dungeon, followed by Inspiration then Mahjraat . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Reckless allows you to bring a Reaver's Ring without having hitchance issues, further detailed in the mob breakdown section. ⬥ Lucky Charms are optional, they average up to 1.2m per run. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tokens are better spent on Port Enhancers for Superior Scrimshaws. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These don't enhance Eldritch piece drop rates. ⬥ Salve Amulet used for Taraket, Skeletons, Zombies and Undead Witch. ⬥ Dreadnips can be used at all bosses. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can be skipped if food is in need. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Dark Bow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Seren Godbow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with an Eldritch Crossbow stored. ⬥ ⬥ Crassian to Pre-Taraket ⬥ Nightmare Gauntlets switch is optional. ⬥ An off-hand Lunging switch is optional. ⬥ Basic ⬥ Advanced ⬥ Advanced - ECB EoF ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An off-hand Lunging Off-hand chaotic crossbow switch is optional. Taraket to Pre-Ambassador (Optional) ⬥ Erethdor's grimoire to overcome hitcaps. ⬥ Advanced ⬥ Advanced - ECB EoF Ambassador ⬥ Vitality Potion used for Split Soul ⬥ Luck of the Dwarves will not improve unique drop rates. ⬥ Erethdor's grimoire to benefit more from Incendiary Shot ⬥ Basic ⬥ Advanced ⬥ Advanced - ECB EoF Relevant Mob Breakdown Crassian Scout ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Ranged hits. Crassian Scuttler ⬥ Life Points : 9,000 ⬥ They attack with moderately damaging Melee hits. ⬥ High defence against Ranged attacks. Crassian Warrior ⬥ Life Points : 22,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Cloaked Zealot ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Summon Crassian : Can spawn Crassian mobs to attack you with. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Armoured Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. ⬥ High defence against Ranged attacks. Ulthven Necromancer ⬥ Life Points : 16,500 ⬥ Summon Undead : Can spawn a continous horde of Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Huge Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Sea Horror ⬥ Life Points : 35,500 ⬥ Scream : A 2,000 typeless hit used at melee distance. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. Enlightened Sotapanna ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with melee abilities for moderate damage. ⬥ High defence against Ranged attacks. Undead Witch ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with a delayed, highly damaging Magic hit. Kal'gerion Demon ⬥ Life Points : 33,700 ⬥ Life Drain : Reduces your Constitution level by 2 ⬥ Demonic Ritual : Reduces all combat stats alongside rapid magic damage to anyone in range. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits otherwise. ⬥ High defence against Ranged attacks. Warped Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Frenzy : Rapid 3,000 magic hits that also heal the Skeleton. Triggers are unknown. ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. First Floor - Pre Crassian Room 1 ⬥ Attack the closest Crassian scout and wait until both scouts are stacked. For the sake of consistency Dark Bow the Scouts into good abilities for the Crabs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can attempt to stack Crabs + Crassians, but its very inconsistent. Room 2 ⬥ Bladed Dive → Surge → Dark Bow / Snap Shot for the Scouts → strong abilities for the Crabs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Don't use Tight Bindings or Binding Shot for this room. Room 3 ⬥ Wait a tick, Chin Tight Bindings the middle Scout closest to the gate, into Dark Bow , cleaning up as seen fit. Room 4 ⬥ Burst the two Zealots with anything at your disposal. How to cut the corner for the next section: Room 5 ⬥ Target the Zealot with Corruption Shot and move back to the spot shown below, this will stack the 2 Zealots + 1 Scout together. ⬥ Swap out to a stronger weapon for the single Scout remaining to finish it off. Room 6 ⬥ Put on your Salve Amulet and target as seen fit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Luring is intuitive here as their position is completely random. Room 7 ⬥ Surge and target the closest Zombie, cleaning up as seen fit. Room 8 ⬥ Manage your adrenaline to be at 100% for Death's Swiftness and don't pray any Deflects or Soul Split . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively, with an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you can Split Soul here with Chins . Never stand here. ⬥ Dragon Breath - This will always be the first mechanic of the fight and is signaled by the Leviathan firing a stationary breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage. Stand off to the side to avoid this. ⬥ Head Sweep - The Leviathan will slam its' head across the ground twice, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area, avoided by moving to the opposite side of where the sweep begins. ⬥ After going through one Dragon Breath and two sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other opposite side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge back to his main head once this happens. Strategy Defensive + Surge → Bladed Dive → Death's Swiftness (at melee distance) + Vulnerability Bomb + Dreadnip → ‎ ‎Dazing / Needle → Split Soul → Improvisation Your primary objective is to fit in 2 Rapid Fire's , 2 Snap Shot's , 4 Greater Ricochet's , 2 Corruption Shot's , and a ‎ ‎varying number of Dark Bow's depending on your adrenaline. Note: Any bleed used will be considered walked as he moves to the opposite side of the arena, use this to your advantage if you're getting 2 cycles. Note: Crabs hit for up to 3K each. Room 2 ⬥ Equip Salve Amulet into good abilities. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Luring is intuitive as their positions are completely random. Room 3 ⬥ Kill the Necromancer and the Huge Skeleton with hard hitting basics, saving 80% adrenaline for the next room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Expect frame drops on the way to the cliff. Room 4 ⬥ to kill the Necromancer. ⬥ Activate your Undead Sigil and Shadow Tendrils with Chins , cleaning up as seen fit. Note: There will be a massive frame drop afterwards, spam click your compass when entering the second floor, into Surge + Bladed Dive the center of the room. Second Floor Entry - Taraket's Entry Room 1 (Artefacts) ⬥ Equip your and ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kill the Necromancer to the West and interact with the guarded artefact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kill the Necromancer to the East and interact with the guarded artefact. Note: When interacting with the artefacts, you're left unable to act until the animation is finished. Equipping your Bladed Dive (or using it to get there) before you activate them is ideal. Room 2 (Bridge) ⬥ Target the Necromancer with a stalled Corruption Shot + Vulnerability Bomb release with a 9sq weapon from this square move back → Bombardment then back in to stack the Horrors and the Necromancer for a . Afterwards you have two options: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safe clear is being at a distance from the horros, cleaning up as seen fit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge MD → Western Horror with → Eastern Horror with Chins , cleaning up as seen fit ⬥ Save atleast 58.5% adrenaline for the next room. Positioning Room 3 ⬥ Auto → will usually instakill them. Room 4 ⬥ Bladed Dive and Surge ‎ ‎as demonstrated to avoid aggro from the Sotapanna's. ⬥ Once in position, use Demoralize on a Necromancer to stack all relevant mobs together. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The gate opens when the 2 Necromancers, and 2 Huge Skeletons are killed. It's easier to triple Bladed Dive for this line instead, it'll just be slightly slower as demonstrated below. Faster form Triple BD - Easier form Note: Judge accordingly if you have (or want) to do a full clear to bank comfortably, with enough speed the Zombie(s) and / or Sotapanna(s) will not reach you in time. Taraket the Necromancer This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes. Mechanics ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged. These autos are slightly stronger than his Magic ones. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity - Upon reaching 200K hitpoints, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly towards one of the two black crystals at the sides of the arena, healing himself and spawning one of the two corpses: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletal mobs until its death. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's auto-attacks. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both of these attack with melee and are very easy to kite if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket can only spawn these once each and will not heal upon hitting 200K HP afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first spawn will always be the closest crystal to Taraket. ⬥ Spirit Line - Taraket smashes the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that will move towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move out of the way as needed be. Strategy The use of Chins gives Ranged an unique distinction for rapid, yet somewhat safe kills at Taraket. It is paramount you properly flick Soul Split and keep a good amount of damage up to sustain yourself through both corpses. Remember to equip your Salve Amulet after using your Essence of Finalities . ⬥ Opener ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• → Dazing Shot → Split Soul → GRico → Rapid Fire → Snap Shot → Needle → GRico ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Roughly at 200k move him to the Carrier Crystal with Rout / Demoralize ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dark Bow to phase him quickly if needed be. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• GRico on the portal with Hydrix to recover adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Blocking his path to the Carrier crystal makes the kill faster, at a significant cost of safety. Doing this wil require you to Bladed Dive right next to Taraket upon reaching phase HP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you achieved a Portal Skip, save GRico for the Corpse Carrier and his skeletons. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The Carrier can be flanked with your first ability by using target cycle. ⬥ Corpse Carrier: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have time (via a Portal Skip) on the Corpse Carrier until Taraket is vulnerable again. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stand on the spot that Taraket will land to avoid using Rout / Demoralize on him. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lure them so they can be 'd together while camping Soul Split . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The Carrier can be flanked with your first ability by using target cycle. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Rout / Demoralize Taraket to move him next to the Portal you didn't stand on the previously mentioned spot. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may Split Soul here with Chins . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rush to 200K HP as fast as possible. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The remaining skeletons will be finished off with as the fight progresses. ⬥ Bloated Monstrosity: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Prepare your Death's Swiftness a few seconds before he's vulnerable again, giving you time to build up as much adrenaline as possible ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Split Soul + Undead Sigil → GRico → Rapid Fire → Snap Shot → Needle → GRico ‎ ‎ → Improvise until the end of the kill. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stay MD of him at all times. Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit Room 1 ⬥ Equip your Salve Amulet → Surge into the Undead Witch. ⬥ Activate your Sigil (if possible), throw a Vulnerability Bomb into strong abilities, saving 58.5% adrenaline for the next room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can flick Soul Split for the Witch' attacks, as her windup animation is really slow. Room 2 ⬥ Activate Demon Slayer then Dark Bow the Kalgerion Demon into GRico . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Hydrix proc'd, follow up with another Dark Bow . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An SGB can be used for the demon and is stronger than the aforementioned Dark Bow . ⬥ Bladed Dive + Surge sideways from the stairs to the next section as shown below. Room 3 ⬥ Kill the Necromancers as you move past them with anything available. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If possible, attempt to ECB and kill both in one Split Soul. Room 4 ⬥ Kill the Necromancers with anything availabe, holding 58.5% adrenaline for the next floor. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If possible, attempt to ECB and kill both in one Split Soul. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip your Bladed Dive just before you jump. Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador Room 1 ⬥ Surge + Bladed Dive to the gate. ⬥ Gauge when will it be appropiate to Dark Bow as their positions are largely random. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A Chin SGB can be used here for a surprisingly decent amount of spread out damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may attempt to Split Soul here with Chins Room 2 ⬥ Try to stack both Skeletons, using Salve Amulet and Undead Slayer into strong abilities for the clear. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip a stronger weapon if they're too far apart from each other. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may attempt to Split Soul here with Chins Room 3 ⬥ Inmediately Dark Bow the middle Zealot and clean up afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may Split Soul here with Chins ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively, attempt to Chincend all mobs for an instant clear! ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zealots may aggro independently of one another, ruining the lure. You can fix it by dragging all Zealots and walking back to the gate you came from. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Skeletons ought to be killed first, and at the same time as you are luring the Zealots. ⬥ Try to stack all mobs if possible., using Salve Amulet and to priorize the Skeleton's death. Room 4 ⬥ Hug the West wall to reduce the chance of the minibosses aggro'ing you, should they aggro alternate Anticipation and Freedom . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may attempt to Split Soul here with Chins ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Don't worry if the mini-bosses attack you, simply bind them / teleport out quickly after the gate is open to bank comfortably. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A faster but slightly riskier way to get there is through this Surge + Bladed Dive as shown below: ⬥ Attempt to stack all four mobs together, clear as seen fit while keeping 100% adrenaline for the entry to Kranon, the Ambassador. Note: Remember to rebind your Brews from your Guthix Rests from your action bar if applicable. Kranon, the Ambassador At the bottom of the abyssal section awaits Kranon, the Ambassador, the final boss of the Elite Dungeon 3. This boss has a moderate learning curve compared to most solo bosses and has a variety of mechanics ranging from DPS checks, area denial, self-healing, and the usage multiple combat styles. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. Ambassador's Attack Rotation ⬥ 1M HP to 550K - Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ⬥ 550K to 400K - Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Uses the same auto attack rotation until Ritual. ⬥ Ritual - Kill ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 autos → Melee/Magic → 5 autos → Melee/Magic → Onslaught 1M-550K HP ⬥ Purple Corruption ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them at the Ritual phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the Sanctum Guardian's mechanic from ED1 but will create two areas instead, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones will last until the final phase of the fight and will ramp up to 2000 typeless damage to anyone standing inside. ⬥ Black Hole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador will spawn a black hole near the area that will explode a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Despawned by stunning it. ⬥ Sinister Fragments ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. At the same time, the Ambassador will fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The entry gate is located East of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He'll use the Fragments every full attack rotation or by hitting the 650K cap until the next phase commences. Beams unleashed ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Failing to destroy a fragment(s) prompts the Ambassador to absorb them, and release a hard hitting typeless explotion per fragment absorbed. 550K-400K HP ⬥ The Ambassador stops spawning Sinister Fragments. ⬥ The Ambassador spawns invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers that deal low ranged damage, making Resonance harder to use. 400K-0 HP ⬥ The Ambassador will stop doing his Corruption and Black Hole mechanics, continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ⬥ Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and infested areas. ⬥ A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The first outburst of smokes are unblockable. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- A white smoke will heal the Ambassador for 2500HP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Standing between the Ambassador and the smokes will make them black, damaging you for a small typeless hit but will not heal the Ambassador. Seiryu arrives Ritual begins ⬥ Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks. Strategy ⬥ 1M HP Note: All Black Holes will be cleared with Rout / Demoralize . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Activate Disruption Shield , Vengeance and equip Hydrix bolts . → ‎ ‎ → ‎ ‎→ + → just right before the next auto hits you and camp + ‎ ‎→ → → → Improvise depending on food, adrenaline and damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Due to the great variance of adrenaline with the usage of Hydrix bolts , this rotation can be tweaked if needed be. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Juicing Spirituals with Ripper greatly increases your speed. Flanking can be used by standing directly underneath him, or by standing South when he summons the Black Hands. ⬥ Spinners ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Activate Disruption Shield and Vengeance as soon as possible. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use anything to kill the first five spinners. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At the 6th spinner you will build to this rotation: Natural Instinct → Basic Defensives → Incendiary Shot → Basic Defensives → Greater Ricochet → Basic Defensives / Bleeds → Death's Swiftness . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The cue to start this setup is roughly at 46s from Spinner start. Any further increases the risk of having to rely on Hydrix bolt and Relentless procs for the setup. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use your Death's Swiftness around 3.6s before he's attackable again. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Split Soul → Greater Ricochet if you need the adrenaline, onto the Ambassador just as soon as he's attackable. ⬥ After Spinners ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• With Split Soul active, your priority is to spam Dark Bow's as much as possible, saving Vitality Potion for the Ritual. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This rotation is RNG-reliant and demands improvisation if your procs / crits fall short. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use atleast one Seren Godbow spec . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If food allows you to, attempt to Split Soul up to three more times in here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• With a good damage output, your Death's Swiftness will be on cooldown as ritual starts. Adapt accordingly with a Split Soul shortly before the Ritual begins. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Ambassador faces Seiryu once he starts the Ritual, allowing you to Flank twice with ease. ⬥ Ritual Note: Not necessarily the start of the ritual, but rather when your DS is finally off-cooldown. Death's Swiftness can be skipped altogether if your hits were extremely good beforehand → ‎ ‎ → ‎ ‎→ + → just right before the next auto hits you and camp + ‎ ‎→ → → → Improvise depending on food, adrenaline and damage. If you're going to get a second Mage Onslaught don't use Vitality + , save it for Reflect + Vitality Example Run https://youtu.be/UdabIzy_0Ac 12:40 by #Pernix https://youtu.be/t2bsgrHq2Wk 13:35 by #Nouzar https://youtu.be/7VfFm4fIrPY 14:05 by #Pernix Table of Contents Introduction [Link]($linkmsg Presets [Link]($linkmsg Relevant Mob Breakdown [Link]($linkmsg First Floor - Pre-Crassian [Link]($linkmsg The Crassian Leviathan [Link]($linkmsg Post Crassian - Second Floor Entry [Link]($linkmsg Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry [Link]($linkmsg Taraket the Necromancer [Link]($linkmsg Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit [Link]($linkmsg Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador [Link]($linkmsg Kranon, the Ambassador [Link]($linkmsg Example Runs [Link]($linkmsg

docs.text: Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow . Each solo run of ED3 is worth 20,363,636 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 81,454,545 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. Disclaimer: The GIFs for boss mechanic descriptions were done under Story Mode.

docs.text: Preset Notes ⬥ Two presets are sufficient for the Reef, the second one is for The Ambassador, as Vitality and Flanking are used for the fight. ⬥ Reckless is the best aura for the dungeon, followed by Inspiration then Mahjraat . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Reckless allows you to bring a Reaver's Ring without having hitchance issues, further detailed in the mob breakdown section. ⬥ Lucky Charms are optional, they average up to 1.2m per run. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tokens are better spent on Port Enhancers for Superior Scrimshaws. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These don't enhance Eldritch piece drop rates. ⬥ Salve Amulet used for Taraket, Skeletons, Zombies and Undead Witch. ⬥ Dreadnips can be used at all bosses. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can be skipped if food is in need. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Dark Bow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Seren Godbow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with an Eldritch Crossbow stored. ⬥ ⬥ Crassian to Pre-Taraket ⬥ Nightmare Gauntlets switch is optional. ⬥ An off-hand Lunging switch is optional. ⬥ Basic ⬥ Advanced ⬥ Advanced - ECB EoF ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An off-hand Lunging Off-hand chaotic crossbow switch is optional. Taraket to Pre-Ambassador (Optional) ⬥ Erethdor's grimoire to overcome hitcaps. ⬥ Advanced ⬥ Advanced - ECB EoF Ambassador ⬥ Vitality Potion used for Split Soul ⬥ Luck of the Dwarves will not improve unique drop rates. ⬥ Erethdor's grimoire to benefit more from Incendiary Shot ⬥ Basic ⬥ Advanced ⬥ Advanced - ECB EoF

docs.title: Second Floor Entry - Taraket's Entry

docs.text: This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes.
docs.title: Taraket the Necromancer

docs.text: ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged. These autos are slightly stronger than his Magic ones. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity - Upon reaching 200K hitpoints, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly towards one of the two black crystals at the sides of the arena, healing himself and spawning one of the two corpses: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletal mobs until its death. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's auto-attacks. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both of these attack with melee and are very easy to kite if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket can only spawn these once each and will not heal upon hitting 200K HP afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first spawn will always be the closest crystal to Taraket. ⬥ Spirit Line - Taraket smashes the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that will move towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move out of the way as needed be. Strategy The use of Chins gives Ranged an unique distinction for rapid, yet somewhat safe kills at Taraket. It is paramount you properly flick Soul Split and keep a good amount of damage up to sustain yourself through both corpses. Remember to equip your Salve Amulet after using your Essence of Finalities . ⬥ Opener ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• → Dazing Shot → Split Soul → GRico → Rapid Fire → Snap Shot → Needle → GRico ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Roughly at 200k move him to the Carrier Crystal with Rout / Demoralize ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dark Bow to phase him quickly if needed be. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• GRico on the portal with Hydrix to recover adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Blocking his path to the Carrier crystal makes the kill faster, at a significant cost of safety. Doing this wil require you to Bladed Dive right next to Taraket upon reaching phase HP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you achieved a Portal Skip, save GRico for the Corpse Carrier and his skeletons. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The Carrier can be flanked with your first ability by using target cycle. ⬥ Corpse Carrier: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have time (via a Portal Skip) on the Corpse Carrier until Taraket is vulnerable again. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stand on the spot that Taraket will land to avoid using Rout / Demoralize on him. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lure them so they can be 'd together while camping Soul Split . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The Carrier can be flanked with your first ability by using target cycle. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Rout / Demoralize Taraket to move him next to the Portal you didn't stand on the previously mentioned spot. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may Split Soul here with Chins . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rush to 200K HP as fast as possible. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The remaining skeletons will be finished off with as the fight progresses. ⬥ Bloated Monstrosity: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Prepare your Death's Swiftness a few seconds before he's vulnerable again, giving you time to build up as much adrenaline as possible ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Split Soul + Undead Sigil → GRico → Rapid Fire → Snap Shot → Needle → GRico ‎ ‎ → Improvise until the end of the kill. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stay MD of him at all times.
docs.title: Mechanics

docs.text: Room 1 ⬥ Equip your Salve Amulet → Surge into the Undead Witch. ⬥ Activate your Sigil (if possible), throw a Vulnerability Bomb into strong abilities, saving 58.5% adrenaline for the next room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can flick Soul Split for the Witch' attacks, as her windup animation is really slow. Room 2 ⬥ Activate Demon Slayer then Dark Bow the Kalgerion Demon into GRico . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Hydrix proc'd, follow up with another Dark Bow . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An SGB can be used for the demon and is stronger than the aforementioned Dark Bow . ⬥ Bladed Dive + Surge sideways from the stairs to the next section as shown below. Room 3 ⬥ Kill the Necromancers as you move past them with anything available. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If possible, attempt to ECB and kill both in one Split Soul. Room 4 ⬥ Kill the Necromancers with anything availabe, holding 58.5% adrenaline for the next floor. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If possible, attempt to ECB and kill both in one Split Soul. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip your Bladed Dive just before you jump.
docs.title: Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit

docs.text: Room 1 ⬥ Surge + Bladed Dive to the gate. ⬥ Gauge when will it be appropiate to Dark Bow as their positions are largely random. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A Chin SGB can be used here for a surprisingly decent amount of spread out damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may attempt to Split Soul here with Chins Room 2 ⬥ Try to stack both Skeletons, using Salve Amulet and Undead Slayer into strong abilities for the clear. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip a stronger weapon if they're too far apart from each other. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may attempt to Split Soul here with Chins Room 3 ⬥ Inmediately Dark Bow the middle Zealot and clean up afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may Split Soul here with Chins ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively, attempt to Chincend all mobs for an instant clear! ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zealots may aggro independently of one another, ruining the lure. You can fix it by dragging all Zealots and walking back to the gate you came from. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Skeletons ought to be killed first, and at the same time as you are luring the Zealots. ⬥ Try to stack all mobs if possible., using Salve Amulet and to priorize the Skeleton's death. Room 4 ⬥ Hug the West wall to reduce the chance of the minibosses aggro'ing you, should they aggro alternate Anticipation and Freedom . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have an Eldritch Crossbow in your Essence of Finality , you may attempt to Split Soul here with Chins ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Don't worry if the mini-bosses attack you, simply bind them / teleport out quickly after the gate is open to bank comfortably. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A faster but slightly riskier way to get there is through this Surge + Bladed Dive as shown below: ⬥ Attempt to stack all four mobs together, clear as seen fit while keeping 100% adrenaline for the entry to Kranon, the Ambassador. Note: Remember to rebind your Brews from your Guthix Rests from your action bar if applicable.
docs.title: Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador

docs.text: At the bottom of the abyssal section awaits Kranon, the Ambassador, the final boss of the Elite Dungeon 3. This boss has a moderate learning curve compared to most solo bosses and has a variety of mechanics ranging from DPS checks, area denial, self-healing, and the usage multiple combat styles. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. Ambassador's Attack Rotation ⬥ 1M HP to 550K - Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ⬥ 550K to 400K - Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Uses the same auto attack rotation until Ritual. ⬥ Ritual - Kill ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 autos → Melee/Magic → 5 autos → Melee/Magic → Onslaught 1M-550K HP ⬥ Purple Corruption ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them at the Ritual phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the Sanctum Guardian's mechanic from ED1 but will create two areas instead, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones will last until the final phase of the fight and will ramp up to 2000 typeless damage to anyone standing inside. ⬥ Black Hole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador will spawn a black hole near the area that will explode a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Despawned by stunning it. ⬥ Sinister Fragments ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. At the same time, the Ambassador will fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The entry gate is located East of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He'll use the Fragments every full attack rotation or by hitting the 650K cap until the next phase commences. Beams unleashed ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Failing to destroy a fragment(s) prompts the Ambassador to absorb them, and release a hard hitting typeless explotion per fragment absorbed. 550K-400K HP ⬥ The Ambassador stops spawning Sinister Fragments. ⬥ The Ambassador spawns invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers that deal low ranged damage, making Resonance harder to use. 400K-0 HP ⬥ The Ambassador will stop doing his Corruption and Black Hole mechanics, continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ⬥ Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and infested areas. ⬥ A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The first outburst of smokes are unblockable. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- A white smoke will heal the Ambassador for 2500HP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Standing between the Ambassador and the smokes will make them black, damaging you for a small typeless hit but will not heal the Ambassador. Seiryu arrives Ritual begins ⬥ Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks. Strategy ⬥ 1M HP Note: All Black Holes will be cleared with Rout / Demoralize . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Activate Disruption Shield , Vengeance and equip Hydrix bolts . → ‎ ‎ → ‎ ‎→ + → just right before the next auto hits you and camp + ‎ ‎→ → → → Improvise depending on food, adrenaline and damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Due to the great variance of adrenaline with the usage of Hydrix bolts , this rotation can be tweaked if needed be. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Juicing Spirituals with Ripper greatly increases your speed. Flanking can be used by standing directly underneath him, or by standing South when he summons the Black Hands. ⬥ Spinners ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Activate Disruption Shield and Vengeance as soon as possible. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use anything to kill the first five spinners. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At the 6th spinner you will build to this rotation: Natural Instinct → Basic Defensives → Incendiary Shot → Basic Defensives → Greater Ricochet → Basic Defensives / Bleeds → Death's Swiftness . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The cue to start this setup is roughly at 46s from Spinner start. Any further increases the risk of having to rely on Hydrix bolt and Relentless procs for the setup. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use your Death's Swiftness around 3.6s before he's attackable again. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Split Soul → Greater Ricochet if you need the adrenaline, onto the Ambassador just as soon as he's attackable. ⬥ After Spinners ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• With Split Soul active, your priority is to spam Dark Bow's as much as possible, saving Vitality Potion for the Ritual. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This rotation is RNG-reliant and demands improvisation if your procs / crits fall short. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use atleast one Seren Godbow spec . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If food allows you to, attempt to Split Soul up to three more times in here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• With a good damage output, your Death's Swiftness will be on cooldown as ritual starts. Adapt accordingly with a Split Soul shortly before the Ritual begins. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Ambassador faces Seiryu once he starts the Ritual, allowing you to Flank twice with ease. ⬥ Ritual Note: Not necessarily the start of the ritual, but rather when your DS is finally off-cooldown. Death's Swiftness can be skipped altogether if your hits were extremely good beforehand → ‎ ‎ → ‎ ‎→ + → just right before the next auto hits you and camp + ‎ ‎→ → → → Improvise depending on food, adrenaline and damage. If you're going to get a second Mage Onslaught don't use Vitality + , save it for Reflect + Vitality

docs.text: Bossing path Bossing Path (Courtesy of #Pernix) This path isn't set in stone. Everyone learns in different ways; however this is a decent route to follow. Additionally, the encounters listed are from a solo perspective, as group encounter requirements can be much more vague. Initial combat experience can be gained by doing general Slayer. This can be used to get the hang of the abilties and what they do. You can also take this chance to get used to some keybinds, as you can go at your own pace during Slayer. Alternatively, you may practice on a dummy, though you won't gain any XP or GP. Twin Furies ⬥ 80 Ranged required, boostable ⬥ Teaches movement and reflexes ⬥ Punishes you for not dealing good damage ⬥ You may find an opportunity to get started with basic defensive ability usage ⬥ #twin-furies Vindicta ⬥ 80 Attack required, boostable ⬥ A common benchmark in basic combat training ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Basic ability priorization and basic defensive usage ⬥ Difficulty and potential learning experience can be improved by adding Soul Split flicking and faster methods. ⬥ #vindicta Helwyr ⬥ 80 Magic required, boostable ⬥ Punishes bad movement ⬥ Requires usage of Freedom and Resonance ⬥ Good place to learn why abilities are where they are in a rotation ⬥ #helwyr Gregorovic ⬥ 80 Prayer required ⬥ Requires good spacing ⬥ Punishes low damage, as the fight gets harder the longer it continues ⬥ #gregorovic At this point you can try any group boss you can access if you want. Beastmaster Durzag is a good starting group encounter to learn multiple roles. Requirements are set by group. Nex ⬥ Frozen Key required ⬥ Ideal fight to learn full manual ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ability usage while moving ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ability prioritization ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Improvisation ⬥ #nex-duo-ranged ⬥ #nex-solo-ranged Araxxi The most common milestone for a player getting into higher PvM. This boss has punishing mechanics to those who tend to be unaware of their surroundings and ability usage. It is highly recommended that you get some experience in the basics before attempting Araxxi with a partner. This is due to duo Araxxi being generally much more punishing than solo, as well as having some additional mechanics. ⬥ Prayer flicking ⬥ Greatly accelerate your training if you are on full manual ⬥ Greatly improve your overall PvM improvisation techniques ⬥ Significantly improve the speed of your reactions ⬥ #araxxor-melee ⬥ #araxxor-range Elite Dungeons | Solo Runs ⬥ Completion of Impressing the Locals miniquest is required for Temple of Aminishi ⬥ Teaches good usage of Surge, Bladed Dive, Acceleration powerbursts ⬥ An endurance test, requires you upkeep combat constantly ⬥ Teaches ideal timing and spacing of AoE abilities ⬥ Exponential difficulty increase as you learn faster runs Elite Dungeon One: Temple of Aminishi ⬥ #temple-of-aminishi-melee ⬥ #temple-of-aminishi-ranged Elite dungeon Two: Dragonkin Laboratory ⬥ #dragonkin-laboratory-ranged ⬥ #dragonkin-laboratory-magic Elite Dungeon Three: Shadow Reef ⬥ #the-shadow-reef-melee ⬥ #the-shadow-reef-ranged ⬥ #the-shadow-reef-magic Raksha | Solo/Duo ⬥ Requires completion of the Raksha, the Shadow Colossus miniquest ⬥ Reactionary prayer flicking, punishes heavily for missed flicks ⬥ Ideal fight to learn Soul Split flicking ⬥ Use of precise movement ⬥ Accurate clicking for Bladed Dive ⬥ Importance of good damage, as the mechanics become more punishing the longer a phase goes on ⬥ Good fight to practice long-term Ranged ability rotations ⬥ #raksha Telos ⬥ Requires the Ancient Sigil ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Obtained from defeating all 4 of the Heart of Gielinor in a solo instance ⬥ Everything you've learnt so far at an Extreme difficulty ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Heavy defensive usage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Heavily punishes low damage output ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Spacing and movement must be perfect ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Teaches usage of many Magic spells ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Magic is generally advised for Telos learners, since it is the safest style and has the lowest entry gear requirements. ⬥ #telos-beginner Other Good PvM Encounters These encounters are very dependant on your skill level and how much you're willing to commit to them. Any Order ⬥ Kalphite King ⬥ Har-Aken ⬥ Yakamaru ⬥ Vorago ⬥ Nex: Angel of Death ⬥ The Barrows: Rise of the Six ⬥ Elite Dungeons | Duo/Trio ⬥ Solak ⬥ The Magister ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Very high requirements and relatively simple, but is very good for practicing long-term high level consistent DPM rotations Stay Away These encounters do not provide anything meaningful to your PvM growth, or have better alternatives elsewhere. They are often reserved for 1-ticking records and other miscellaneous endeavours. Bosses to Avoid ⬥ Kalphite Queen ⬥ King Black Dragon ⬥ Queen Black Dragon ⬥ K'ril Tsutsaroth ⬥ Kree'arra ⬥ General Graardor ⬥ Commander Zilyana ⬥ Giant Mole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surprisingly, you can learn basic defensive usage here ⬥ Corporeal Beast ⬥ The Barrows Brothers ⬥ Chaos Elemental ⬥ Dagannoth Kings ⬥ Tztok-Jad ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Recommended to learn prayer flicking elsewhere ⬥ Legiones ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Relatively high requirements for how little rewards this boss gives Table of Contents Bossing Path [Link]($linkmsg Other Good Bosses [Link]($linkmsg Bosses to Avoid [Link]($linkmsg

docs.text: Interface guide Credits to #Hoobs and Trollster Introduction Having a proper interface setup is important as it allows you to organize your game view and have quick, convenient access to game windows that you frequently interact with such as inventory, gear, ability bars, etc. Uses of Tertiary Action Bars Tertiary action bars can be used as a quick access tool for many things. ⬥ Condense ability books (i.e. Defensives and Prayers). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Having prayers and defensive abilities on an ability bar is handy because it lets you only see what you need rather than trying to find the ability/prayer you want out of the whole book. ⬥ Keybind extra actions (i.e. Food and Prayers). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is useful because it makes it easier to eat or flick prayers while you are busy moving and/or reacting to mechanics with your mouse. ⬥ Have stuff that are used with every style so that the main bar has more room (i.e. Food, Mobility abilities, Constitution abilities). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Again, having a universal ability bar with food and abilities that apply to all combat styles is important so you can always have access to what you need regardless of what combat style is being used. ⬥ Fill remaining empty slots with niche stuff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Example: full gear switches for Solak hybridding, quick access to abilities/inputs for Ingenuity of the Humans + Seren Godbow special attack, etc. ⬥ Weapon and Shield keybinds if using an MMO mouse ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can remap the buttons of an MMO mouse to some hard to reach buttons on a keyboard to effectively give yourself more keybinds. Creating an Interface ⬥ Creating a good interface is all about displaying your game windows in a way where everything you need to access is open and are close to each other so you can minimize the distance your eyes and mouse need to travel around your screen. RS3 Default Interface There are a lot of things wrong with this interface. Game windows are spread across the screen on corners and most of the space is unused. Essential Game Windows for Combat ⬥ Ability bars ⬥ Inventory ⬥ Gear ⬥ Familiar ⬥ Prayer ⬥ Minimap ⬥ Chatbox Nonessential but Preferred Game Windows ⬥ Skills ⬥ Friends List ⬥ Friends Chat List ⬥ Clan Chat List ⬥ Group Chat List Classic RS2 Interface This is not a horrible foundation for an interface, but there are some easy improvements that can be made. ⬥ Just by reorganizing a bit and adding the ability book with all ability tabs adds some quick access, and with the addition of focusing all of the game windows towards the bottom right, the interface is much more optimized. ⬥ The interface is organized in a way where everything on screen is important, but the more you need to interact with something, the more it is focused towards that bottom right corner ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For example, chat boxes aren't as important, so they are farther away from the essential corner. Gear and inventory tabs are heavily interacted with, so they are at the focal point of the interfaces here. ⬥ Switching the ribbon into Edit Mode can be done by clicking on the icon with a box and a pencil. ⬥ Editing the buttons on the ribbon can be done by clicking on the cog icon. ⬥ Inventory dimensions can be customized by going to Settings → Gameplay → General → Inventory → Dynamic backpack columns.* Example interface ⬥ Split private chat can be turned on in Settings → Gameplay → Social → Chat Customization → Split private chat. Edit Layout Mode Advanced settings ⬥ The Buff and Debuff bars are extremely important in PvM. Having them in a practical place close to the middle of the screen where your attention will mostly be is important. ⬥ The chatbox is set to NOT click-through. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This setting can be found in Gameplay → Interfaces → Game Interaction → Click-through chatboxes. docs.text: Having a proper interface setup is important as it allows you to organize your game view and have quick, convenient access to game windows that you frequently interact with such as inventory, gear, ability bars, etc.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Tertiary action bars can be used as a quick access tool for many things. ⬥ Condense ability books (i.e. Defensives and Prayers). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Having prayers and defensive abilities on an ability bar is handy because it lets you only see what you need rather than trying to find the ability/prayer you want out of the whole book. ⬥ Keybind extra actions (i.e. Food and Prayers). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is useful because it makes it easier to eat or flick prayers while you are busy moving and/or reacting to mechanics with your mouse. ⬥ Have stuff that are used with every style so that the main bar has more room (i.e. Food, Mobility abilities, Constitution abilities). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Again, having a universal ability bar with food and abilities that apply to all combat styles is important so you can always have access to what you need regardless of what combat style is being used. ⬥ Fill remaining empty slots with niche stuff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Example: full gear switches for Solak hybridding, quick access to abilities/inputs for Ingenuity of the Humans + Seren Godbow special attack, etc. ⬥ Weapon and Shield keybinds if using an MMO mouse ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can remap the buttons of an MMO mouse to some hard to reach buttons on a keyboard to effectively give yourself more keybinds.
docs.title: Uses of Tertiary Action Bars

docs.text: ⬥ Creating a good interface is all about displaying your game windows in a way where everything you need to access is open and are close to each other so you can minimize the distance your eyes and mouse need to travel around your screen. RS3 Default Interface There are a lot of things wrong with this interface. Game windows are spread across the screen on corners and most of the space is unused. Essential Game Windows for Combat ⬥ Ability bars ⬥ Inventory ⬥ Gear ⬥ Familiar ⬥ Prayer ⬥ Minimap ⬥ Chatbox Nonessential but Preferred Game Windows ⬥ Skills ⬥ Friends List ⬥ Friends Chat List ⬥ Clan Chat List ⬥ Group Chat List Classic RS2 Interface This is not a horrible foundation for an interface, but there are some easy improvements that can be made. ⬥ Just by reorganizing a bit and adding the ability book with all ability tabs adds some quick access, and with the addition of focusing all of the game windows towards the bottom right, the interface is much more optimized. ⬥ The interface is organized in a way where everything on screen is important, but the more you need to interact with something, the more it is focused towards that bottom right corner ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For example, chat boxes aren't as important, so they are farther away from the essential corner. Gear and inventory tabs are heavily interacted with, so they are at the focal point of the interfaces here. ⬥ Switching the ribbon into Edit Mode can be done by clicking on the icon with a box and a pencil. ⬥ Editing the buttons on the ribbon can be done by clicking on the cog icon. ⬥ Inventory dimensions can be customized by going to Settings → Gameplay → General → Inventory → Dynamic backpack columns.* Example interface ⬥ Split private chat can be turned on in Settings → Gameplay → Social → Chat Customization → Split private chat.
